loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 29 years old. He is married with three children aged eleven, seven and four years. He sells secondhand clothes in Nakuru. He has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD after he was introduced by a field officers. He repaid his previous loan successfully and in time.

He will use this loan to add on to his savings and purchase a piece of land where he can later build a house for his family. He hopes to venture into a rental houses business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Alie

texts.en: Pictured here is Alie. The sixty-two-year-old was born in Fadugu, near Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has five children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. Alie has a bar where he sells both hard and soft drinks. He has been running this business for three years now. Alie has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city to request a loan of 4,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to buy crates of both hard and soft drinks to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy crates of both hard and soft drinks to add to his business

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen is married with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop from home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for 10 years. She also gets additional income from selling charcoal. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, rice, flour, soap, and sugar. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow into wholesale and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy jerrycans of cooking oil, rice, maize flour, soap and sugar

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single mother of one child and the child goes to school. She takes care of her mother. She operates a beauty salon from home on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 5 years. She also has rental houses where she gets additional income. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a hand dryer, hair oils, braids and hair treatments. Her major business challenges include the increasing price of cosmetics, seasonality and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow big up to a bridal salon, educating up to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, food and utilities.

loans.use: To buy a hand dryer, hair oils, braids and hair treatments

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells used clothes in a shop. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing price of used clothes. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and also wants to educate her children up to university level and also to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Juan es u hombre muy trabajador y sobre todo carismático, vive al lado de su esposa quien en su mano derecha y quien lo apoya en todo siempre, juntos tiene 2 hijos, cuyas edades comprenden 13 y 2 años, por quienes trabaja muy duro sobre todo porque los ama muchísimo y quiere que sean mejores que el. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú; el distrito de Santiago se caracteriza que se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de esparrago, uva, algodón, paprika, entre otros, en el se albergan muchas empresas agroexportadoras quienes otorgan fuentes de trabajo a los pobladores de la zona. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear y también disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería Eléctrica.

Día a Día Juan Luis trabaja en su negocio como chofer de Taxi, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 12 horas diarias y sobre todo cuando es fin de semana a veces no va a almorzar a su hogar porque aprovecha estos días para tener un dinerito extra; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muchas ganas de hacer bien su trabajo y porque tiene mucho carisma con los clientes.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, el colocara ventanas, pondrá piso, tarrajeara las paredes, terminar de construir su cochera; con esta mejora podrá tener una vivienda adecuada para su familia ya que tendrán más seguridad, ya que está muy cerca la temporada de invierno ya no pasara mucho el frio en su vivienda; así el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar una parcela de cultivo”.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking, and above all a charismatic, man.  He lives with his wife who is his right hand and who supports him in everything, always.  They have 2 children together aged 13 and 2 years, for whom he works very hard, above all because he loves them very much and wants them to be better than he is.  

His house is located in the district of Santiago, Ica, Peru.  The district of Santiago is characterized by development in agriculture, escpecially the cultivation of asparagus, grapes, cotton, and paprika, among other crops.  It contains many agro-export businesses which offer sources of work to the inhabitants of the zone.  When he has free time he likes to go for walks, and also enjoy one of his favorite dishes which is the delicious "ceviche".  He only attended secondary school, but would have liked to study electrical enginerring.

Day by day Juan works at his business as a taxi driver, dedicating about 12 hours a day to the business. Especially on weekends, he often doen't go home for lunch because he uses these days to earn extra money.  He believes that he does well in his business because he has a great desire to do it well, and because he has a lot of charisma with his clients.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because the help that they are providing him  will allow him to achieve some improvements in his house.  He will  install windows, lay a floor, decorate the walls,and finish builfding his garage.  This will allow his family to have more security, as the winter season is approaching and the cold will not enter his house as much.In this way will be able to continue fighting every day to realize his greatest dream:  to own his own piece of land for farming.

loans.use:
Para mejoramiento de vivienda (colocar ventanas, pisos, tarrajeo de paredes, entre otros).
To improve his house by installing windows, floors, wall treatments, and others.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 60, is married with five children and lives in Kasese,Uganda. He has milling machines for produce and has also been in the transport business for nine years. His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business goals are to buy land to grow crops and expand his business into new markets. James wants a loan to buy a new car engine, tires, and a maize milling machine.

.

loans.use: to buy a new car engine and tires plus a maize milling machine.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick, 41, is married and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children to attain degrees. He has been running a food produce business for the last six months and the business is steadily growing. He has been facing the hardship of inadequate capital to purchase stock. His vision is to diversify his business to include farming and to expand to new markets. Patrick needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Carolina Jacqueline

texts.es:
La socia Carolina nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la hermosa donde nació, ella tiene 45 años de edad y tiene un hijo. La socia Carolina tiene un  taller de mantenimiento de carros y tiene varios empleados, ella administra el taller y le va muy bien. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La socia Carolina requiere el préstamo para comprar lubricantes. Su sueño de Carolina es tener una tienda de venta de lubricantes y un hotel.    
  
La socia Carolina pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Carolina is a member who was born in the city of Cusco and continues to live in this beautiful city. She is 45 years old and has one child. Carolina has an auto maintenance shop with several employees. She manages the shop and is doing very well. Carolina has been in this business for several years and has done an excellent job thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is requesting a loan in order to buy automobile lubricants. Her dream is to open a store that sells lubricants and a hotel.

Carolina is a member of the San Antonio Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco Province.

loans.use: to purchase automobile lubricants.

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a hard-working man living in Fort Portal ,Uganda. He has been selling produce, specifically maize, for the last five years. Price fluctuations and inflation are factors hindering his business. His vision is to expand his business to new areas and diversify his business to include other cereals such as beans and ground nuts. Clovice needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 58, is a businessman married to Monica, a business lady. They are blessed with two children. He has been supplying milk for the past three years with a monthly income of KES.18,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the program by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy milk cans and milk to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his family. He hopes and dreams to own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy milk cans and milk to sell.

loans.name: Genis Fidèles Plus Group

texts.en:
Malela is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Genis Fidèles Plus,” which is composed of 25 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Malela, 58, started his business in 2007. He manages his own general store in the West of Kinshasa. He works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his area. His business generates a profit of US$90 per week. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by purchasing, soaps, vegetable oil, and sacks of rice and reselling them at a profit. Malela is a married and has five children aged between 10 and 22. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying soap, vegetable oil, and sacks of rice to resell at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Edgar Fredy

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Camana, Ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas hermosas playas, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, también se desarrolla la pesca y sobre todo en esta ciudad se puede encontrar  varios platillos típicos en especial el Chupe de Camarones. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus vecinos y amigos de  su barrio y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son las riquísimas “lentejitas”. 

Día a día Edgar trabaja en su negocio como agricultor, trabaja en el campo alrededor de 8 horas al día y también trabaja como pescador en especial en horas de la madrugada que es donde se puede pescar mejor; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque siempre tiene a Dios a su lado.

Edgar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina para su casa ya que actualmente el cocina sus alimentos en una cocina a leña, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Edgar is a very hardworking and enthusiastic man.  He lives in the city of Camaná, a city known for having beautiful beaches.  There is also agriculture there, especially rice growing, as well as fishing.  Above all, in this city you can find several traditional dishes, especially shrimp chowder.  When he has some free time he likes to play soccer with his neighbors and friends in the neighborhood.  He also likes to eat one of his favorite foods, a delicious lentil dish.

Day by day Edgar works in his business as a farmer.  He works in the fields around eight hours a day.  He also works as a fisherman, especially in the dawn hours when the fishing is better.  He believes that it is going well for him in his business because he is very responsible and, above all, because he always has God at his side.

Edgar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy a stove for his house, because currently he cooks his food on a wood stove.  In this way he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working every day to make his biggest dream come true: "Improve his home."

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two blow dry machines, weaves, and hair oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bicycles to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza, 50, is married with two children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling fish for two years and, with the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and build a house. Her hardship is customers not paying on time. Her personal goal is to educate her children. Her business goal is to move her business to a more permanent location. Eliza wants the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Azizjon

texts.ru: Азизчон проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 41 год. Он женат. Образование у него высшее. Он военнослужащий. По профессии Азизчон проработал два года. На сегодняшний день он предоставляет услугу. Азизчон работает трактористом в дехканском хозяйстве. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки новой швейной машинки своей жене.
texts.en: Azizjon lives in the Dangara region. He is 41 years old, married, and has attended university.  A soldier by training, he has worked in this profession for two years.  For the past four years, he has been providing such services as operating a tractor in a dehkan farm.  He is taking a loan to buy a new sewing machine for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his wife

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet, 28, is a single mother of two children, ages 11 and 7. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to the program by a KADET field officer. She will use the loan to lease more land for farming so she can raise her income. She hopes to own her plot of land in the near future.

loans.use: to lease more land for farming.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, 60, is married with 10 children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the bar business for seven years and the business is very profitable as he is assured of daily income. His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is to build a permanent home. His business goal is to diversify his business. Emmanuel wants a loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi est une femme de 27ans. Elle a 01 enfant de 02ans et est mariée à un revendeur. Son activité est la vente d’eau minérale en sachet communément appelée « PURE WATER ». Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2010 et le fait dans une boutique louée à cet effet. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes. Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille. Elle veut développer son activité et assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Amavi is a 27-year-old woman. She has a two-year-old child and is married to a retail merchant.

Her activity consists of selling pouches of mineral water commonly called "PURE WATER". She has been running her business since 2010 in a shop rented for this purpose. She buys from wholesalers.

This is her first loan from WAGES and she is requesting this loan to buy goods in order to better meet her family's needs. She wants to expand her business and ensure the education of her child.

loans.use: Buy mineral water

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is married with five children and only two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells bananas and tomatoes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of bananas and boxes of tomatoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to see her business grow into a wholesale business and also to start growing tomatoes herself. She would also like to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas and boxes of tomatoes .

loans.name: Shaloom Plus Group

texts.en:
Mpesi, 59, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Shaloom Plus." It is composed of 22 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Mpesi has been part of the micro-enterprise since 1992. She sells salted fish. Her business is located to the midwest of Kinshasa. Mpesi works hard with good management in order to expand her business. The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy more salted fish to resell at retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $65 per week. Mpesi is married and the mother of six children whose ages vary between 31 and 41. One of them is a student.

loans.use: to buy more salted fish to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Danize

texts.en: Danize is a 38-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.She sells boiled meat and has been in business for three years. Her hardships are price fluctuation and inflation, and her personal goal is educating her children. Her business goal is moving the business to a more permanent location. Danize wants money to buy meat to sell.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Femme de 58ans, adjowa est mariée à un retraité et a 06 enfants. Le premier a 36ans et le dernier 23ans. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle a décidé de vendre depuis 1976 du SODABI (boisson alcoolisée), des œufs et autres. Elle exerce l’activité  avec les enfants dans une boutique et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter du SODABI, des œufs et divers. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Adjowa is 58 years old. She is married to a retiree and has six children. The eldest is 36 years old and the youngest is 23.

To provide for her family, she decided in 1976 to sell Sodabi (alcoholic beverage), eggs and other items. She runs her business from a shop with her children and is requesting this loan to buy Sodabi, eggs and various other items.

She wants to reinvest in her business activity and expand it.

loans.use: Buy Sodabi, eggs and various items

loans.name: Montagne Sud Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Montagne Sud est créé depuis le 28 mars 2008.Le groupe PS2 est composé de cinq femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont comme principales activités l'élevage et le commerce.

L'emprunteur vedette madame Binetou est âgée de 36 ans; elle est mariée mère de trois enfants deux filles et un garçon. Elle mène une activité d'embouche ovine et bovine et fait parallèlement de la couture, elle capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 5 ans.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en wax,couverte d'un châle rose et a levé la main gauche.

Elle achète ses sujets au foirail de la ville et revend après 5 à 6 mois d'embouche.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt spécial acheter 2 moutons et 2 vaches qu'elle va engraisser et compte se faire beaucoup de revenus à la vente.
Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour développer son épargne et soutenir son mari dans la gestion quotidienne des dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Montagne Sud "Banc Villageois" (local loan association) was created on March 28, 2008. The PS2 group consists of five women living in the same neighborhood and whose major activities are farming and trade.

The borrower being featured is Ms. Binetou who is 36 years old. She is married with three children: two girls and a boy. She runs a sheep- and cattle-fattening business and has a parallel activity as a seamstress. She has accumulated five years' experience. On the photo she is standing to the right dressed in a "wax" pagne and a pink shawl, and is raising her left hand.

She buys her livestock at the city's fairground and sells them after five to six months of fattening.

With her special loan she wants to buy two sheep and two cows she will fatten and is counting on substantial benefits from the sale.

She plans to use her profits to expand her savings and support her husband in dealing with her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: Buy sheep and cows to raise for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a single 25-year-old youth client and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Karar is a grocer; in 2008 he opened his own shop selling fruits and vegetables. He has good experience in this field, a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is applying for a $2400 “youth loan" in order to extend and redecorate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life as a whole.

loans.use: to extend and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Julio Enrique

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 23 años el cual es muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor en cualquier época del años, también en el encontramos a la alguna de Huacachina la cual se encuentra en medio de espectaculares dunas y recibe a muchos turistas en todo el año. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le gusta disfrutar de su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pollo”. Con el fruto de su trabajo el pudo estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica, sobre todo estudio esta carrera porque le gusta mucho arreglar automóviles.

Día a Día Julio trabaja en su negocio de venta y reparación de celulares, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 5 clientes en el día ya que depende del tipo de reparación que realice; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque su negocio se ubica en un lugar muy concurrido por el publico y también porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio en especial nuevos equipos celulares, así mejorara sus ingresos y así podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño: Tener un local propio para su negocio ya que el actual es alquilado”.
texts.en:
Julio, 23, is hard-working, enthusiastic young man who lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm and welcoming climate any time of the year.  Here is also where the Huacachina Lagoon, surrounded by spectacular dunes, receives many tourists all year long.  In his free time, Julio enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbors, and also enjoys eating his favorite dish, "arroz con pollo" (chicken with rice).  With the money he earned from his work he was able to get a mechanical engineer degree, which he chose because he likes to repair automobiles.

Every day Julio works at his cell phone repair and sales business, where he spends approximately eight hours and attends to up to five customers a day, depending on the repairs he must do.  He believes business is going well because it is in a busy location and also because he is kind to customers.

Julio is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their help, since he can buy more merchandise for his business, especially new cell phone equipment.  This will improve his income and will allow him to continue working toward his goal: "To have his own store, since he rents the one he is in now".

loans.use: To buy cell phone equipment.

loans.name: Jilda Manuela

texts.es: La Sra. Jilda  esta emprendedora se dedica a la venta  de  mercadería en general inicio su actividad como una herramienta de trabajo para poder ayudar con los gastos de su familia,   Jilda ya ha tenido crédito con fundación lo cual  ha demostrado ser responsable , trabajadora , y con solvencia de pago, ella está solicitando el desembolso para invertir en la compra de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes como:   blusas de diferentes tallas, pantalones de adultos , niños, jóvenes,  camisas sport, sandalias, zapatos de niños , esta emprendedora  realiza su actividad económica de forma ambulante, y gracias al apoya que fundación león 2000le ha brindado ha podido hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Jilda is an entrepreneur who sells general merchandise for a living.  She started her business as a work tool for making extra income to help cover household expenses.  Jilda has had previous loans through the foundation and has proven herself to be responsible, hard-working, and punctual in her payments.  She is requesting a loan to buy products in high demand such as blouses in different sizes, adults', children's and youths' trousers, sport shorts, sandals and children's shoes.  Jilda is a street vendor and, thanks to the support from Fundación León 2000, she has been able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy blouses in different sizes, adults', children's, and youths' trousers, sport shirts, sandals and children's shoes.

loans.name: Sugeyda Agustina

texts.es: Sugeyda Agustina Su actividad económica es la venta de comida. Tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio. Ella se levanta temprano ya que todos los días tiene que buscar los alimentos necesarios para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos como gallo pinto, queso frito, tajadas, empanadas de maduro y pollo frito. Actualmente todos los días vende sus diferentes platillos por lo que sus clientes disfrutan mucho de su comida, ya que poco a poco fue estableciendo su propia fama. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, aceite, pollos, azúcar y ciertos utensilios de cocina. Gracias al financiamiento que fundación le brinda ha podido establecerse y hacer crecer su negocio y clientela.
texts.en: Sugeyda Agustina sells food for a living and has a lot of experience in the business.  She gets up early every day to buy the foods necessary to make her delicious dishes like gallo pinto (rice and beans), fried cheese, fried plantain chips, plantain empanadas, and fried chicken.  She has built up a good reputation little by little because of how popular her dishes have become among customers.  Thanks to loans from the foundation she has been able to establish and grow her business and customer base.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, oil, chicken, sugar and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is married with three children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (Mother and Father). She operates a pub in a rented house. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 10 years. She also gets additional income from selling piped water .She has applied for a loan of  700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda, tables and chairs. Her major business challenges include off and on electricity and defaulters. She is hoping to see her business grow into a wholesale business and get a fully stocked pub. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: To buy beer, soda, tables and chairs

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is a 35-year-old single mother with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on her and her dream is to educate her children up to the University. She has been selling clothes for six years. She got her initial capital from milk sales a business she used to do. Her hardship is inadequate capital to meet the different customer demands and her business goal is expanding the business into new markets. Peace wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 1 1/2 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through a restaurant.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is hoping to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, paying utility bills and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 37-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children since she did not have a chance to study due to lack of school fees. She has been running a retail shop and a salon for the last six years. Her major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock and her vision is diversifying her business to include farming. Grace needs a loan to buy salon equipment and general merchandise such as salt and sugar.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and general merchadise such as salt and sugar.

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirna de 51 años de edad es una mujer viuda que sostiene a sus  3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 24 años porque es muy emprendedora y esto lo hace  con su propio negocio, mediante el cual  desarrolla varias actividades: fabrica pasabocas,  como productos derivados de la harina de trigo en pequeñas bandejas; mercancía que promociona mediante guías especializadas y bolsos, que compra en sitios especiales de la ciudad.  Su aventura de negocio inició cuando al no lograr trabajar como empleada en empresas, decidió genera sus propios recursos mediante un trabajo independiente. Hoy ha logrado una gran clientela, porque inició vendiendo entre amigas y poco a poco, mercancía variada; con ello le fue bien y  posteriormente agregó deditos de queso empacados,  dirigidos a convertirse en pasabocas en los eventos  festivos y para los vendedores de comidas rápidas del sector. Hoy su clientela ha crecido y como  tiene el compromiso de lograr la educación profesional de sus hijos, por eso quiere hacer crecer su negocio, para poder conseguirlo. Este es el propósito de acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, para la preparación de pasabocas y  mercancías, que en su revista llegaron con descuentos especiales con las cuales quiere impactar a su clientela y aumentar su volumen de ventas. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local comercial estratégicamente ubicado, pero su mayor desafío es el capital de trabajo para ello, y esto es lo que la impulsa a trabajar persistentemente, pero muy seguramente  con la ayuda paulatina de su credikiva  logrará alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mirna, 51, is a widow who supports her three children between the ages of 14 and 24 because she is a very enterprising woman.  She does this with her own business through which she develops various activities: snack foods she makes such as products made from wheat flour in small trays; merchandise that she advertises through catalogs; and bags which she buys in special places of the city. 

Her business venture started when she was not able to work as a company employee. She decided to create her own income through self-employment.  Today she has a large customer base because she began by selling to friends and little by little she varied her merchandise. She did well this way and later she added packaged cheese fingers, aimed at making them festive snacks and at the fast food vendors in the area. 

Today her customers have grown and she has a commitment to her children’s professional education and for this reason she wants to grow her business.  This is the purpose for accessing Credikiva, her first loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy raw materials and supplies to prepare snacks and merchandise.  The merchandise in the catalog arrived with special discounts which she wants to use to impress her customers and increase the volume of her sales. 

Her goal later on is to have a strategically located commercial premises, but her biggest challenge is having the working capital.  This is what drives her to work persistently, but it is very likely that with that help of this loan, she will achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies to prepare snacks and merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance, car radio, speakers and school supplies.

loans.name: Liria Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Liria tiene 36 años y es casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 14, 12 y 7 años, ella se dedica al tejido de mantas desde hace ya 5 años, su taller se encuentran en la zona de Ayamayo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Liria  utilizara este préstamo para compra de máquina de tejer para así facilitar el tejido de mantas ya que antes lo hacía de manera artesanal y esto no le permitía tejer en cantidades y no podía cumplir con sus pedidos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Liria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar el tejido de mantas y producir en mayor cantidad,  y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando su  capital de trabajo, la Sra. Liria es un apersona emprendedora con ganas de crecer en su negocio y con el tiempo desea exportar sus tejidos, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Liria, 36, is married and has three children, aged 14, 12 and 7.  She has been knitting blankets for five years in her workshop in the Ayamayo area.  This loan is her first from the institution.  She plans to use it to buy a knitting machine to make the blankets she used to craft by hand.  This will enable her to increase production and fill all the orders she has, which she could not do before.  The loan will be used as working capital.  The challenges Liria is up against in her business are improving the blanket quality and increasing production volume.  She will use the profits to continue increasing work capital.  Liria is an enterprising woman who is determined to get ahead and begin exporting her products.  She is happy and grateful for the support received from the instititution.

loans.use: To buy a knitting machine to make blankets.

loans.name: Mukonomura Womens' Gp Group

texts.en: Margret a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goals include educating his children, building a permanent house and buying a car. She is a farmer and has been farming for the last six years. She has hardships of price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather variations. Her vision is to expand her business to new markets and hire employees to help expand. She has applied for a loan to help her weed and put soil and water conservation trenches in her banana plantation.

loans.use: To put soil and water conservation trenches in her farm.

loans.name: Sabbatique Plus Group

texts.en:
Josée, aged 43, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Sabbatique Plus”, which is composed of 21 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Josée has been in the business world since 2002. She sells corn flour. She manages her business in the Eastern part of Kinshasa. She intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of her goods by buying some sacks of corn flour to resell with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $30. 

Her ambition is to expand her business. Josée is married and has three children who are between 10 and 14 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of corn flour to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 46-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent home. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years. After starting on family land, he then bought his own land.He is facing hardships of price luctuations, inadequate capital to purchase stock and unpredictable weather changes, However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas,buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help him expand his business .John needs a loan to buy animal drugs, chemicals and barbed wires for his farm.

loans.use: to buy animal medications, chemicals and barbed wire.

loans.name: Maximino

texts.en: Maximino is a 48-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He grows fruits and vegetables to sell. He also buys from other farmers so he can have more to sell. He works hard to support his family and sustain his children's education. He requested a loan to buy more bananas and yam to sell. Maximino hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and yam to sell

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is a single mother of three children. Two of her children go to school. She takes care of her grand children .She sells charcoal at the market on a t retail She works for six days a week. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of shs 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.   Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and thieves. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and also buying a track to transport her charcoal. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees,rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Cesar  Augusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar tiene 34 años no es casado pero tiene dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 4 años,  es  un cliente antiguo antes era socio del grupo solidario raza de bronce, es un cliente  puntual  en sus pagos por tal motivo no se dudo en darle otro crédito.  El cliente se dedica a la venta de comida  en una pensión que es  de su propiedad en la zona  Villa Victoria de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito se destinara en la implementación de otro negocio que es el de poner un café internet y desea comprar equipos para este negocio pero también seguir fortaleciendo su  negocio que es la venta de  comidas, el Sr. Cesar es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Cesar is 34 years old. He is not married but he has two children, aged 8 and 4. He has been a client for a while, and before what a member of the Raza de Bronce communal bank. He is a punctual client with his payments, so there was no doubt about giving him another loan. He sells food in a restaurant he owns in the Villa Victoria area of La Paz. The loan will be used to open another business, which is an internet cafe. He wants to buy some equipment for that business and also strengthen his business selling food. Cesar is a very hardworking person who is happy with the opportunity being offered to him.

loans.use: to open another internet cafe business

loans.name: Francis P.s.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These teachers have applied for a loan of 11,600,000  Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. This will be the first loan this group of teachers will be accessing from Kiva lenders. School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf. 

Francis is the head teacher at the school and leader of this group. The fifty-seven-year-old is married with five children who are attending primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. Francis has been a teacher for thirty-three years. Francis will use his share of this loan to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.name: Vainqeurs Plus Group

texts.en:
Charlène is a chairwoman of a Community bank named “Vainqueurs Plus”, which is composed of 19 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
 
Charlène sells second hand clothing. She started her business in 2009. With hard work and determination, she succeeded in making it thrive thanks to good management and accumulated profits. She intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing one second hand bundle of clothing in order to increase the profit. Currently, she earns a profit of $80 every week. Charlène is twenty-six years old, divorced and the mother of two children aged four and eight years old. One of them goes to school. Her dream is to open a general boutique in her environment.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying one bundle of used clothing to resell at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cinthia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cinthia es una joven muy trabajadora y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. Este distrito se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería, también encontramos el bosque de Piedras, el cual es un conjunto de cerros de piedra en forma de animales, personas, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión en especial sus novelas favoritas, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos tallarines rojos. Ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.

Con mucho optimismo y entusiasmo Cinthia trabaja  en su negocio de venta de hamburguesas, pollipapas y salchipapas, ella se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día en especial en horas de la tarde donde hay más clientes; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene una buena sazón para la preparación de los platillos y sobre todo amabilidad con sus clientes.

Cinhtia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina para freír papas, pintado de fachada de su negocio, compra de sillas y bancas, lo que le permitirá dar una mejor a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a hardworking and enthusiastic young woman. She lives in the district of Parcona, Ica, Perú. This district is characterized as having a warm climate and for having agriculture and cattle. There is also the stone forest, which is a group of rocks shaped like animals, people, and more. When she has free time, she likes to watch television, especially her favorite novelas. She also likes to eat one of her favorite traditional dishes, the delicious tallarines rojos. She only finished high school, but she would have liked to study nursing. 

With much optimism and enthusiasm,  Cinthia works in her business selling hamburgers, chicken and fries, and sausage and fries, She works at her business for about 10 hours a day, especially afternoons when there are more customers. She believes that it is going well in her business because she is a good cook when making her food and she is friendly to her customers. 

Cinhtia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy a stove to make fries, paint the outside of her business and buy chairs and benches. This will allow her to give better service to her customers and improve her income. This way she can keep working to make her biggest dram come true: own her own house.

loans.use: to buy a stove, chairs, benches, and to paint the outside.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a forty-eight-year-old married man. He has two children aged three and ten. He describes himself as a go-getter and a social man. He operates a retail stall where he sells furniture such as chairs, cupboard, sofa sets, wardrobes, tables etc. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located within a busy market which has many tenants and his primary customers are tenants, landlords and the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high costs and shortages of wood. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wood to make furniture. His business goal is to extend his workshop and run many more workshop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will run a fully stocked workshop.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells bananas at the market. She sells her products on retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for ten years. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. She generates additional income by selling fruits like pineapples and oranges. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of bananas. She aspires to seeing her business grow into a wholesale business and also to start going to the villages of Masaka to purchase bunches of banana. She would also like educate her children to university level. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Manassé Plus Group

texts.en:
“Manassé Plus” is a group of fifteen owners of small businesses chaired by Bibi. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Bibi sells variety of foods such as squashes, caterpillars, beans, mushrooms, and miscellaneous. She became a micro entrepreneur in 1988. Her business is located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. She has already received twelve loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. 

She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy some sacks of beans, caterpillars, mushrooms, squashes, and miscellaneous to resell at a profit. Currently she earns a profit of US$90 per week. Bibi is fifty-seven years old, married and the mother of an eighteen-year-old son who attends school. Her dream is to someday open a cold room to keep fresh food in her environment.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by buying some sacks of beans, caterpillars, mushrooms and squashes to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Risden

texts.en: Risden is thirty years old and a married man with a twelve-year-old child. He is a seaweed farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. Risden is also involved in fishing. He works hard to provide for his family's basic needs and sustain his child's education. He requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings and fishing nets. Risden hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and fishing nets.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Goreti is single mother of four children. Three of her children go to school. She takes care of her grand-children. She operates a kiosk at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for seven years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy sweets, biscuits, cakes and bags of bread. Her major business challenges include seasonality and when the children are on school holiday. She aspires to seeing her business get big so that it grows into a retail shop and also aspires to buying a plot of land and building a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of bread, cakes, biscuits and sweets.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en: Roseminda is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is twenty-one years old, married, and has two young children. Roseminda and her husband, who is a fisherman, run a fishing business together. She needs additional capital to purchase a fishing boat and fishing nets. Roseminda hopes her loan will help increase their business profitability. She also hopes for her family to have a progressive life.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Kimya Plus Group

texts.en:
“Kimya Plus” is a group of eleven owners of small businesses chaired by Nzenza. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Nzenza is a photographer. He started his business in 1998 with a start-up capital of US$70. With hard work and determination, his business prospered. Nzenza is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups. He has already received nine different loans from the MFI HOPE RDC and has repaid them properly. His business has been reinforced through the different loans he received. 

Nzenza intends with the next loan to purchase some negative films and camera items in order to increase his profits. He is thirty-six years old, single and has a son of fourteen who goes to school. Currently, Nzenza makes a profit of about $100 per week. His dream is someday to open a beverage facility in his area.

loans.use: to purchase some negative films and camera items in order to increase his profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sherina

texts.en:
Sherina is married with one child who goes to school. She has no additional family members. She is a tailor and also sells second-hand clothes. She operates her business from home. She works six days a week. She has been in business for two years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy materials to make clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to seeing her business grow into a wholesale business and to educating her children to university level. She would also like to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and transport.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en: Joselito is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is twenty-one years old, married, with a one-year-old child. Joselito owns a fishing boat. His income goes toward providing for his family's daily consumption. He works hard to improve his earnings and be able to save for the future. He requested a loan to repair his fishing boat. This will help Joselito continue his business and earn for his family.

loans.use: to repair his fishing boat.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is thirty years old, married, with five children. The oldest child is nine years old.

Ruel's family relies on his fishing. He works hard to catch more fish to sell. He also ventured into seaweed farming to help augment his income. He requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and seaweed seedlings. Ruel hopes to expand his fishing business. He also hopes to provide for his family's basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is forty-two years old and is a married woman with five children aged between fourteen and twenty-three. She and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. 

Edisa needs a loan to purchase a fishing boat. This will help them bring in more fish to sell. Edisa works hard to improve their income and sustain her family. It is her goal to have her children finish college and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Ronelio

texts.en:
Ronelio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has three children aged nine, ten and twelve. Ronelio earns 6,000 PHP per month from fishing. His income goes on his family's daily consumption and children's education. He hopes to have additional income to improve his family's living situation. 

He requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. Ronelio hopes to build up more savings for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Jerecson

texts.en:
Jerecson is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for almost seven years. Jerecson works hard to support his family of a wife and two children. 

He requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. Jerecson hopes to have a stable business that will allow him to provide a proper education for his children. It is his desire to see them have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Sheirel

texts.en:
Sheirel is thirty-one years old and is a married woman with three children aged two, seven and nine. She runs a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. Her income goes on her family's daily consumption and her children's education. 

She needs a loan to purchase a boat engine. Sheirel hopes to earn better and be able to sustain her family. She also hopes to become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine.

loans.name: Grupo 1, 2 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the “Grupo Brisas 1 & 2” (Breezes 1 & 2 Group). The group is comprised of fifteen members with small businesses who sell different products. Francisca’s family is made up of her long-term partner and their three children. They live in a rented home, which is a simple structure built of wood. Her most difficult challenge has been always working to bring in extra income for her family and provide for her children's education. She enjoys to work.

Francisca’s business is a small butcher shop. She sells bacon, pork and salty beef. She will use this new loan to buy several pounds of this meat. She has been working in this business for about four and a half years. This is her 6th loan with Esperanza Internancional. She will use her business profits to help with the needs of her family and her house: she will be able to buy more and better food and save so that in the long-term they will be able to have their own house. 

This group is located in an area with scant resources in the city of Santo Domingo. It is to the north of the city.

loans.use: to buy several pounds of meat (pork and beef).

loans.name: Champions Plus Group

texts.en:
Régine, aged forty-nine, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Champions Plus”. It is composed of ten members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Régine has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2005. She sells beverages. Her business is located to the north-east of Kinshasa. Régine has already received loans from MFI HOPE DRC five times and repaid them correctly. 

The loan she will obtain next will be used to buy more crates of drinks to resell retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $15 per week. Regine’s ambition is to become a beverage provider in her area. She is a widow and the mother of six children whose ages range from nine to thirty-two. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying some crates of beverages to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is twenty-three years old and is a married woman with a two-year-old child. She is a seaweed farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. Aside from seaweed farming, she also sells personal-use products and detergent soap. Cristina works hard to support her husband in providing for their needs and saving for their child's education. 

She requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings and more merchandise to sell. Cristina hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Martin tiene 57 años y es soltero con 3 hijos ya independientes, el es agricultor tiene su parcela que se encuentra la localidad El Porvenir, el Sr. Martin es cliente antiguo de la institución, ya que  este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Martin  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y también para los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por la falta de capital para la siembra de papa, el Sr. Martin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando la siembra la cosecha de sus productos, el vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Martin is 57 years old, he is single and has 3 children who are already grown up. He works as a farmer and has a plot of land which is located in the locality of El Porvenir. 

Martin is a long-standing customer of the micro finance institution, as this loan is his fifth loan cycle with them. Martin will use this loan to buy seeds to plant potatoes, as well as to cover the costs of preparing the land. 

The reason for requesting this loan is due to a lack of capital to plant potatoes. The challenge Martin faces in his business is to improve his quality of life, and he will use the profits to continue to improve the planting and harvesting of his products. He sells his goods in the local market, selling directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Milagros Del Rosillo

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer de 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, con 1 hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia con su hijo en el distrito de  Tambogrande, departamento de Piura; la actividad económica  en la zona es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio, cuentan también con los servicios básicos de agua, luz y desagüe. 

La actividad que desarrolla Milagros es la venta de cerveza, este negocio lo tiene  en su domicilio, donde atiende a sus clientes y cuenta con tres años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, además se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, donde le permite tener otros ingresos.

El monto solicitado por Milagros es de S/. 800 nuevos soles, lo cual será para la compra de  cerveza, para atender a su clientela y además de realizar compra de sillas, lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Milagros is a 22-year old single mother with 1 child in her care.  She lives with her son in her own house in the district of Tambogrande, located in the Piura district.  The economic activities in this area are agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.   They also have basic services such as water, electricity and drainage.

The activity that Milagros carries out is the sale of beer.  She has the business in her home, where she tends to her customers.  She has three years of experience in this type of business and, in addition, she sells beauty products to generate other income.

The amount requested by Milagros is 800 Peruvian soles.  She will use these funds to buy beer for her customers, and also chairs, to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy beer and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Ivette Maria

texts.es: Ivette Maria esta Sra. es casada en ocasiones anteriores ya se le ha brindado financiamiento lo cual ha demostrado ser horonda, cumplida  con sus pagos y con alta solvencia moral, en la actualidad  Ivett  está solicitando el crédito para la construcción de sus casa  ella con su propio esfuerzo ha comprado un terreno y necesita comprar el material para dicha construcción, el sueño de Ivett es tener un lugar propio donde vivir con su familia y este sueño solo lo ha podido cumplir poco a poco con la ayuda del financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado.
texts.en: Ivette Maria is married and, on the previous occasions where she has been provided with financing, has demonstrated herself to be honorable, responsible with her payments, and to have a high moral reliability.  Currently, Ivette is requesting this loan for the construction of her house.  She, through her own effort, has bought some land and needs to buy materials for said construction.  Ivette’s dream is to have her own place to live with her family, and she has only been able to make this dream a reality little by little with the financial assistance that Fundación León 2000 has provided for her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials:  cement, bricks, zinc, flooring, lime and sand, among other items.

loans.name: Wilmer Martin

texts.es:
Martin es un joven muy responsable y trabajador, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano de derecha y sobre todo su mayor apoyo, juntos tiene un pequeño de 3 años de edad quien es su adoración y sobre todo su motor y motivo de vivir y salir adelante día a día sobre todo para que sea una persona de bien y sea mejor que él. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, hermosas playas, atractivos turísticos hermosos como las “Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura y la pesca y también se le conoce por la calidez de sus pobladores. Cuando Martin tiene un tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte sobre todo jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, también de vez en cuando aprovecha la oportunidad de comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. El solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería de Sistemas.

Con mucho esfuerzo Martin trabaja en su negocio de venta de pescado, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias, el ofrece sus productos especialmente a los restaurantes de la zona, especialmente a los que preparan el riquísimo ceviche ya que este platillo es a base de pescado; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy conocido y sobre todo ofrece productos en buen estado.

Martin está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado, el podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (pescado al por mayor), ya que tiene varios pedidos, lo que le permitirá mejorar  sus ingresos y su calidad de vida , para así seguir luchando cada día y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprarse un terreno para construir su casa propia y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Martin is a responsible and hard-working young man who lives alongside his wife, his right hand and greatest supporter.  Together, they have a 3-year old child who they adore, is their reason for living and getting ahead each and every day, and who they want to be a good person.  His home is located in the city of Pisco, which is characterized for having a warm climate, beautiful beaches, and wonderful tourist attractions such as the Ballestas Islands and the El Candelabro of Paracas geoglyph.  Likewise, the area is an agricultural and fishing zone, also known for friendly residents.  In his free time, Martin likes to play sports with his friends and neighbors, soccer in particular, and occasionally take the opportunity to eat one of his favorite foods, the delicious “Rice with Duck”.  He only finished secondary school, but would have liked to study Systems Engineering.

With great effort, Martin works his business selling fish.  He works around 8 hours per day, offering his products mainly to the area’s restaurants, especially those who prepare the delicious ceviche, a fish-based dish.  He thinks things are going well with his business because he is well known and, most of all, he offers a good product.

Martin is very thankful for the Kiva loans since, thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy more merchandise (fish at wholesale) since he has several orders.  This will permit him to improve his income and standard of living, and to continue struggling each day to make his greatest dreams a reality:  “To buy land for building his own home and to provide a good education for his child”.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fish at wholesale).

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 47-year-old, hardworking man who has four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a policeman by profession and has been in this service for 20 years. His dreams are to educate his children and build a permanent house. Stephen needs the loan to buy land on which to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy land on which to build a permanent house.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en: Cipriana is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married to a fisherman. Cipriana sells snack foods and home-cooked meals to her community. She is able to help provide for her family's daily needs with her income. She has applied for a loan to buy cookware and ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices. Cipriana hopes to be able to earn more money as well as start a sari-sari (convenience) store business.

loans.use: to buy cookware and ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 40-year-old, married woman with six children between the ages of 3 and 19. Her husband is a utility worker.

Cristita sells various items in her store such as soft drinks, biscuits and toiletries. Her income is used to provide for her family's daily consumption. 

Cristita finds it difficult to replenish her merchandise rapidly. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries and snack foods. 

Cristita's dream is for her family to have a more stable way of life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries and snack foods.

loans.name: Sezi

texts.en:
Sezi is a 55-year-old, married man with eight children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Sezi has been selling books for two years. His hardships include price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather. His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house and pay his taxes. 

His business goals are to diversify and move his business to a more permanent location as well as expand his business into new markets. 

Sezi has requested a loan to buy books to sell.

loans.use: to buy books to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has nine children, eight of whom are school-age. 

Divina sells processed sea cucumbers and seashells. She has a regular buyer, which makes it easier for her to sell her products. Divina works hard to improve her business. She requested a loan to buy more sea cucumbers and seashells to sell. 

Divina's hopes for the future are for her business to grow and for her children to finish college and become successful.

loans.use: to buy more sea cucumbers and seashells to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 44 years old, married and has four children, ages 16, 19, 21 and 26. 

Laura and her husband run a fishing business. Laura sells her husband's catch at the market. She requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and gasoline for the boat. Laura hopes to expand their business and improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and gasoline.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in her town Nocnocan, Talibon. She sells items like snack foods, toiletries, sugar and coffee. Mary Jane wants to provide for her family's basic necessities. She does her best to be a good seller and retain regular customers.

Mary Jane would like to request a loan to buy more merchandise to sell and to renovate her store. She hopes that her store will attract more customers and have increased sales.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell and to renovate her store.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.en:
Reinerio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is 41 years old, married and has four children. 

Reinerio's family relies on his fishing. He works extra hard to supply his family's needs and sustain his children's education. 

He applied for a loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and lead weights. Reinerio wants his family to be able to eat three times a day. He also hopes for his children to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and lead weights.

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is a 31-year-old married man with one child living Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been operating a boutique for three years and he got his initial capital from his salary savings since he is a teacher.

His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes. 

His personal goals are educating children, building a permanent home and self education. 

His business goals are diversifying the business, moving the business to a more permanent location and expanding the business into new markets.

Amon wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Damigou

texts.fr: Revendeur de pneus, ciment et vélo d’occasion depuis 2011, Damigou un jeune homme de 28ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Il exerce son activité dans une boutique et a de nombreux clients. Pour bien répondre aux désirs des clients, il sollicite ce premier prêt de WAGES pour acheter de l’huile à moteur, des vélos et des tonnes de ciments. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité assurer sa prospérité et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Damigou is a 28-year-old man who has sold tires, cement and second-hand bicycles since 2011. He is single and has no children. He works in a store and has numerous customers. 

To better meet the needs of his customers, Damigou has requested this first loan from WAGES to purchase engine oil, bicycles and several tons of cement. He plans to reinvest his profit in his activity to ensure that he prospers and to better look after himself.

loans.use: to buy second-hand bicycles, engine oil and cement.

loans.name: Yemalin 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEMALIN 1 est composé de douze personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement du nom de Nadège est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nadège est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Nadège est mariée à un certain Henry. Le couple a deux enfants scolarisés et à leur charge. Nadège n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Nadège vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différents besoins de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Nadège vend des sacs de maïs, des nattes et de l'akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs) dans un marché du Benin depuis cinq ans. Nadège s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ces activités, Nadège contribue aux différents besoins de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Nadège sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement YEMALIN 1.
texts.en:
The Yemalin 1 group has 12 members who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Nadège, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. Nadège is 25 years of age and lives in Benin. She is married to Henry, and the couple has two children under their care, who are at school. Nadège herself did not go to school. She lives with her children and husband, and together the couple meets the different needs of the family.

To contribute to her family’s various needs, Nadège sells bags of corn, mats and akassa (a corn-based paste) in a market in Benin, and has done so for the past five years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. Thanks to the income generated by these activities, Nadège contributes to her family’s various requirements. To meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she has requested a loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Yemalin 1 group.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a projector, renovate the video hall and buy food.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man with four children. 

He has been in the fishing business for quite some time now. His income goes to the family's daily consumption. Virgilio works hard to improve his earnings and be able to elevate his family's standard of living. 

He applied for a loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights and floaters. Virgilio hopes to achieve his goals soon.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, lead weights and floaters.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a rice farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She 43 years old, married and has an 18-year-old child. Evelyn works hard to help provide for her family. 

She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Evelyn hopes to earn better and be able to improve her family's living conditions. She also hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Neverless

texts.en:
Neverless is a 34-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been dealing in drinks and eggs for ten years. She started with 600,000 UGX from the savings she got from farming. 

Her hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and seasonal weather.

Her personal goals are educating her children, building a permanent house and self education. Her business goals are buying land to grow crops, moving the business to a more permanent location and expanding the business into new markets.

Neverless wants money to buy beer and eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Everketh

texts.en:
Everketh is a 41-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been selling fish for ten years. Her hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock and lack of modern preservation methods.

Her personal goals are educating her children and buying a car. Her business goals are diversifying her business, buying land to grow crops and moving the business to more permanent location. 

Everketh wants money to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Madame Maty  habite dans l’une des  banlieues  du Sénégal. Elle est veuve et évolue dans le secteur du commerce. Elle  vend  du savon liquide et autres produits de détergents divers. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité. Elle consacre 10  heures de temps de la journée à  son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la zone et sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs dans le but d’acquérir des produits qui seront destinés à la vente.  Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices,  d ‘augmenter le niveau de son épargne et de gérer  correctement les factures d’électricité de sa maison. Elle souhaite  rentabiliser ses économies et parvenir à financer son activité a travers son propre fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Maty lives in a Senegalese suburb. She is a widow, and works selling liquid soap and other miscellaneous detergent products. She has been working in this field for more than ten years, and each day she works for ten hours. She is a member of the area’s local U-IMCEC branch, and has requested a loan of 400,000 francs to purchase products which she will then sell. 

Maty hopes to increase her profits, see her savings grow and correctly manage her household electricity bills. She also plans to make the most of her savings and eventually finance her business through her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy detergent products for resale.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTOGBE 1 est formé de sept personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Kadégnon Philomène, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo.
