She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business. She would also like to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Yoliza

texts.es:
Yoliza es una joven madre de 24 años. Gracias a su esfuerzo logró comprar su casa propia donde vive junto a su hijo Francesco de 3 años; quien es el motivo de todo el esfuerzo que realiza.

Ella se dedica a labrar la tierra para cultivar plantas de cacao, labor que lleva realizando hace cuatro años y asegura que le va muy bien. Para mantener sus terrenos y durante la cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros quienes conocen sus terrenos. Las cosechas que realiza Yoliza las lleva a comercializar a los centros de acopio de su localidad, quienes le remuneran buenas ganancias por cada kilo. Su prioridad es poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas para que siempre den buena producción.
Desde que se enteró de los préstamos que brinda MFP no dudó en solicitar en informarse para seguir desarrollando sus planes.

Este es su primer crédito y se siente agradecida la oportunidad que le brindan. Por su parte, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por trabajar con personas responsables.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yoliza is a 24-year-old young mother.  Thanks to her effort she managed to buy her own house, where she lives with her three-year-old son Francesco, who is the motivation for all her effort.

She works the land to grow cacao plants.  She has done this work for four years and she guarantees that it is going very well for her.  To maintain her plots of land and during the harvest she has the help of day laborers who are familiar with her land.  Yoliza takes her harvests to sell at the distribution centers of her town, where they give her good profits per kilo.  Her priority is to be able to maintain all her plants so they always produce well.

Since she found out about the loans that MFP gives, she did not hesitate to inform herself about continuing to develop her plans.  This is her first loan and she is grateful for the opportunity it gives her.  For her part, she promises to be punctual in making her payments.  Also, she is grateful to her communal bank for working with responsible people.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN) that she is requesting she will buy bags of fertilizer to fertilize her fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plants and fertilizer, as well as to clean his plots of land.

loans.name: Gloria Marisol

texts.es:
Gloria, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, comprándose un surtido de ropa nueva blusas, faldas, short, camisetas, con lo que espera tener una acepacion de los clientes y poder ofrecerles la variedad de estilos.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le permitio crecer y tener mercadería necesaria para atender de la mejor manera a  los clientes, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado su familia se encuentra mejor.
texts.en: Gloria is applying for a new loan in order to continue investing in her business, buying a new inventory of new clothing such as blouses, skirts, shorts and t-shirts, with which she hopes to attract more clients and be able to offer them a variety of styles. She thinks that the previous loan helped her to grow the business and to have the necessary merchandise to better attend to her clients and that her economic conditions have improved and her family finds itself in a better position.

loans.use: purchase blouses, skirts, shorts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la inversión en el negocio, comprara sodas, refrescos, quesillo, repollo, aceite, con estos productos espera continuar trabajando para su familia, que le generen mejores ingresos.
Ella considera que  el préstamo anterior fue una gran ayuda para ella y su familia crecio en el negocio, mejorando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan to invest in her business by purchasing sodas, beverages, soft cheese, cabbage, and cooking oil.  With these products she hopes to continue working for her family, and she hopes they generate better income.

She feels that the previous loan was a big help to her and to her family.  Her business grew, which improved her income.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beverages, soft cheese, cabbage, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ulchaboi

texts.ru: Улчабой женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 8 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Отходы от выращивания идут на корм скота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемую прибыль. Он намерен использовать свою прибыль для ремонта своего дома. Улчабой хотел бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ulchaboi is married and has two children. For over eight years he's made a living by growing crops and buying and selling cattle. The leftovers from the crops go towards feeding the cattle. Ulchaboi wants to expand his business and obtain higher profits. With those profits, he'll be able to repair his house. 
Ulchaboi is asking for a loan in order to purchase some livestock and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy sweet and Irish potatoes, rice, flour, bananas and serving plates. Her major business challenges include seasonality and increasing rental fees. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own business premises. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, serving plates, sweet potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es:
Claudia, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mercadería para crecer con su negocio, comprando productos no perecederos para el negocio como granos básicos, aceite, condimentos, pastas, con esto espera tener un aumento en sus ventas.
El efecto con el préstamo anterior fue muy bueno, mejoro la variedad en el negocio, ha tenido mejores ventas y mas trabajo para obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Claudia is requesting a new loan in order to purchase merchandise to grow her business. She plans to purchase nonperishable products, such as staple grains, oil, condiments, pasta, etc, and she hopes this will lead to an increase in sales.

Her previous loan was extremely helpful, and allowed her to offer a wider variety of products to her customers, as well as increase her sales and overall income.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, oil, condiments, pasta.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en: Odbayar is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and his children are school and kindergarten students. He started his grocery shop business in 1996. His shop location is good, and his shop is well-known around the neighborhood for his nice service and quality products. Ever since he opened his shop, his business has been expanding steadily. Many buildings have been built around the neighborhood; therefore, his market demand is increasing. He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more grocery supplies at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery supplies at wholesale prices

loans.name: Oeng's Group

texts.en:
Oeng is a 50-year-old mother of four children. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Two of her four children work at the family's business as farmers. To make a living, Oeng has been farming rice on her 2.5 hectares of farmland, and she has been in this business for 33 years. With her current business, she can earn up to KHR 13,800 each day to support her family. She has faced a challenge with the lack of working capital for her business. 

This is the first loan for Oeng's group with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more rice to sell for a good profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Enhbolor

texts.en:
Enhbolor is 43 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her husband quit his work due to a health condition and her daughter is a school student. 

Enhbolor started her garment retailing business in 1998 by renting a counter in the market. Her garments are very high fashion and reasonably priced. Over the years, she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. 

She's requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase summer garments. She's a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my daughter is growing up, she needs my support more than ever."

loans.use: To purchase summer garments.

loans.name: Batnasan

texts.en:
Batnasan is 52 years old and lives with her three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her elder child helps with her business and her younger sons are college students. 

She started her construction material retailing business in 2006 by renting a counter in the market. Over the years she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. She started off by selling only door locks. Now she sells various kinds of materials. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my business is picking up, I am finally able to help with my son's college tuition." 

She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with two children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members: her brother and his son. She sells secondhand clothes at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in business for 5 years. She also gets additional income from selling piped water.

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a wholesale business and building rental houses. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Susana  tiene 40 años tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 17 y 23 años, la Sra. Susana se dedica a la  venta de comida, ella vende pollo al espiedo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Susana utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de asador para pollo al espiedo por su negocio la razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero, para la compra de un asador que mucha falta le hace e n su negocio, la Sra. Susana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela para así generar mayores ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar cosas para su hogar y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Susana is 40 years old and has three children that are 17 and 23 years old.  She works in food sales and sells rotisserie chicken.  This is her first loan cycle with the bank.   Susana will use the loan to buy a chicken grill for her business.  

Susana needs the loan because she lacks the money to buy a grill herself, and it's important that she buys one for her business.  Susana is facing some challenges in her business, as it is difficult to increase her clientele and thus increase her income.  She will use the earnings from her business to buy household items and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie chicken grill

loans.name: Yuldoshboi

texts.ru: Юлдошбой уже более 20 лет занимается купле- продажей скота, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он покупает скот на местном базаре и выращивает их в течении 6 месяцев, а затем продает за выгодную цену. В бизнесе помогает супруга. На полученный доход от бизнеса хочет купить мебель для своего дома. Юлдошбой запрашивает займ для покупки 6 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
For over twenty years, Yuldoshboi has made a living by buying and selling cattle, as well as raising crops. He purchases cattle at the local market, fattens them for a period of six months and then sells them for a profit. His wife helps him run the business. 

Yuldoshboi would like to obtain some furniture for his house using proceeds from his business. He's asking for a loan in order to buy six heads of short-horned cattle. He's hoping for your help and generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Felictus

texts.en: Felictus is single with four children, and two of them are in school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 10 years. She also gets additional income from selling charcoal. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to build own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but they have no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Myanganzul

texts.en: Myanganzul is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband operates a taxi service by his motorcycle. Her children are school students. She started her garment business in 2002 by renting a counter in a market. Over the years, she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. Her products are highly fashionable and reasonably cheap. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says,"It was hard to expand my business when my children were young. Now that they are old enough, I finally have an opportunity to expand my business." She is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to expand her range of products.

loans.use: To expand her range of products

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be social, honest and committed. She operates a beauty salon and has a retail store where she sells gas cylinders and provides hair services such as plaiting, blow drying, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delays in the refilling of gases into the cylinders. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to purchase more gas cylinders. Earlier on, Ann had requested a loan of Kes 50,000 which she managed to pay off well.  

Her business goal is to run another gas selling retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses and educate her children.

loans.use: to add to her stock of gas cylinders.

loans.name: Gladis Aidee

texts.es:
Gladis, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir más en el negocio, comprara leche para elaborar queso y cuajada, con esto espera tener mejores ingresos en sus ventas y poder tener trabajo para seguir mejorando con su familia.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, teniendo la mercadería necesario para vender, sus condiciones han cambiado, teniendo mejores ganancias para su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis is seeking a new loan to invest in her business.  She will buy milk so that she can process cheese and curd.  With this she hopes to increase her sales and she will be able to continue working in order to continue improving her family's situation.

With her previous loan she had a positive outcome.  She had all the necessary merchandise to sell, her conditions had changed, and she made a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy milk in order to continue processing dairy products.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 21 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades e 1 y 4 años. Él se dedica desde hace 5 años, a la venta de plantas ornamentales, negocio que inició desde hace 5 años, con un capital producto de la liquidación como empleado de un vivero, donde aprendió a cultivar plantas y cuando estuvo listo para desarrollar su autonomía,  empezó en el patio de su casa a cultivar y sembrar semillas para venderlas  a clientes en diversos viveros, negocio que aun tiene. Su meta es crecer cada día más y hoy tiene el gran desafío de tener un capital de trabajo mas, para comprar en mayor volumen semillas y plantas para el jardín así como poteras donde crezcan hermosas plantas, que al final adornaran las casas, oficinas de muchos de sus clientes. Esta es la razón de su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para cumplir con su propósito de crecimiento. Su sueño es poseer su propia vivienda y un lote de gran tamaño, donde pueda cultivar plantas y extenderse en otros nichos de mercado.
texts.en:
Ismael is 21 years old, and lives with his partner and their two children, ages one and five. He has made a living for the past five years selling ornamental plants. He started his business five years ago with capital that he received in a package when he ended his previous job at a plant nursery. In his time spent working in the nursery, he learned how to grow and cultivate plants, and when he was ready to tackle the trade on his own, he started by planting seeds and growing plants in the patio of his home. He sold his products to clients of various nurseries, and still continues those sales.

His goal is to grow his business a little bit every day, and to increase the amount of seeds and plants he can buy. He wants to buy larger pots for growing beautiful plants that will one day live in the homes and offices of his clients. This goal of growth has led him to request a loan through Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. His dream is to own his own home on a large lot where he can cultivate plants and offer a wider variety of products to fill more niches in the market.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in bulk, plants for his nursery, and pots for growing beautiful plants.

loans.name: Tumennast

texts.en: Tumennast is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and his children are school and kindergarten students. He started his public transportation business in 2005 with his own vehicle. Over the years he has gained many regular customers, and his business is highly in-demand. However, his vehicle broke down, and it needs serious maintenance to run properly. He is a sharp and hard-working man who says, "Since my business is the only source of income for my family, I can't afford to lose my business like this." He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with four children, and two of her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (Mother and Father). She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of second-hand clothes. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent, and transportation.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with six children and three of her children go to school. She takes care of her mother. She sells secondhand clothes door to door on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for 5 years. She also gets additional income from selling piped water to her neighbors. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality, the ever-increasing prices of clothes and defaulters. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a wholesale business and also to start importing used clothes. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and for food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Bintiabed

texts.en:
Bintiabed is a married woman with two children, and one of them is in school. She has been selling clothes for the past six years. In addition, she operates a green grocery, selling to her neighbors. She aims at opening a boutique in the future. Credit defaulters are a major challenge hindering the growth of her businesses. 

Bintiabed has rented a house that has electricity but no piped water. She joined Yehu to get loans. This loan of Ksh 40,000 will enable her to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zevegsuren

texts.en: Zevegsuren is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed, and their two children are school students. She started her sewing business in early 2011. Even though she's fairly new to the business, she has a vast amount of experience in sewing, and she has a professional certificate. Her business is well-known around the neighborhood for her skills and excellent service. Now that her business is picking up, she needs a more powerful sewing machine and more raw materials. She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy additional equipment and raw materials.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells vegetables and fruits and operates her business from home. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 7 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, watermelon and pineapples. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into a wholesale business and to start growing some of those fruits and vegetables herself. She would also like to buy a plot of land so as to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, watermelon and pineapples.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 35 years old, married to Tobias, and blessed with two children, aged seven and four years respectively.  She sells clothes, a business she started two years ago, and she earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 25,000 to purchase two bales of jackets and a bale of bedcovers. The profit she earns will be plowed back into her business. 

Her dream is to see her business expand to greater levels. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of jackets and a bale of bedcovers.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 27 years old, married to Grace, and blessed with two children, aged six and four years respectively.  He is a boda-boda (motorcycle) operator, a business he started five years ago, and he earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

He wants to start another line of business; that is, an electronic shop, and so he has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase electronic spares to stock the shop. 

The anticipated profit will help him expand this business. He dreams of being a renowned supplier of electronic spares in town. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase electronic spares.

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento De La Cñia. Yhaca Roysa Group

texts.es:
La juntade Saneamiento de la Compañia Yhaca Roysa  fue creada el 2 de setiembre del año 2006 y desde la fecha hasta hoy en día provee del liquido imprescindible a los vecinos de esa zona.
 Actualmente la junta de saneamiento cuenta con dos pozos y dos tanques propios, la distribucion de agua y todos los usuarios cuentan con medidores en su totalidad, lo que permite ayudarles a tener este servicio importante. Gracias a esta aguateria 308 personas pueden tener agua y de esa forma tener acceso a algo tan imprescindible para todo ser humano.
Solicitan el crédito para la excavación de un nuevo pozo, con lo cual desean poder seguir haciendo llegar a las personas este servicio tan importante.
texts.en:
The Sanitation Board in the Yhaca Roysa Company was created on September 2, 2006, and since that time it has provided essential fluids to the residents in the region.

Now the board says that with two wells and two of their own tanks, they distribute water to all of their users, and continue to provide this important service.  Thanks to this water source, 308 people can have water and for this reason, they have access to something so essential for all human beings.

The board is seeking a loan to excavate a new well, which they need to be able to continue bringing to the people this important service.

loans.use: to drill a new water well.

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en: Gorreti is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells second-hand shoes at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand shoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but they have no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Rodis Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of Rodis Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 800,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married to a businessman, and they have two children—one in primary school and one in secondary school. Isatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells palm oil, onions, salt, pepper, fish, etc. With her share of this loan, Isatu will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, salt, pepper, fish, etc., at wholesale to add to her inventory

loans.name: Virginia Wangari

texts.en:
Virginia used her previous loan amount to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. She was able to plant and harvest and it was very profitable. She was able to pay all the loan amount well and in good time.

This will be her second loan and she plans to buy potatoes, beans, and maize seeds, as well as buy fertilizer for use on her farm during this planting season.

In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her farming methods and make more income, hence improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, beans, and maize seeds, as well as buy fertilizer for use on her farm during this planting season.

loans.name: Oluwafemi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLUWAFEMI est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et exercent des activités complémentaires. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Aurore, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Aurore est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Janvier. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Aurore n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Aurore vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et  assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de huit ans que Aurore mène comme activité la vente de chaussures et de produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Aurore achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Aurore sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OLUWAFEMI.
texts.en:
The OLUWAFEMI group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood and have complementary activities.  The group's representative, Aurore, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  It is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase its level of activity.

Aurore is 40 years old and she is married to a man named Janvier.  Aurore and Janvier have four children, all in school and their dependents.  Aurore never went to school.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

Aurore has been selling shoes and cosmetic products, from her home, for close to eight years.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

Eager to better meet her customers' needs and in order to increase her income, Aurore is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the OLUWAFEMI group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a professional sewing machine, workstation, closet & shelving and pay for initial advertising.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 12 to 26. He describes himself to be honest, social, and determined. He operates a school where he provides education. He has been involved in this business for 23 years and employs 19 staff members. His business is located in a residential area, and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the 45,000-Kenyan-shilling (KES) loan to pay for the construction of secondary-school classrooms. Patrick had taken out a loan of 45,000 KES, which he repaid fully. His business goal is to run a fully improved secondary school within five years. He hopes that, in the future, his school will be the best in the region, and that he can introduce e-learning.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of classrooms

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, es agricultor y ganadero, tiene 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia, ha logrado mantener a su familia con el trabajo en la agricultura y ganadería, desde muy joven inicio con esta ocupación, lo aprendió de su padre, hasta esta fecha no ha tenido mayores inconvenientes en su oficio. 
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos, pues está iniciando la siembra de maíz para ello es importante aplicar el abono y los herbicidas, para que el cultivo esté libre de plagas  y pueda desarrollarse y ser productivo, este préstamo le ayudara para darle el recurso económico y comprarse los materiales.
La aspiración de José es tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia, espera que a través de su esfuerzo pueda ofrecerla y cubrir todas las necesidades importantes del hogar.
texts.en:
José is a farmer and a rancher.  He is 55 years old and lives in his own house.  He has managed to support his family with his work in farming and ranching.  He started with this occupation from a very young age.  He learned it from his father.  To date he has not had any major problems in his job.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies because he is starting the corn planting.  For this it is important to apply the fertilizer and herbicide, so the crop is free of pests and can develop and be productive.  This loan will help him, give him the economic resources to buy himself the materials.

José's goal is to have better living conditions for his family.  He hopes that through his effort he can offer that and cover all the important household necessities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her business and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business so that she starts importing the clothes from Mombasa. She also wants to build her own rental house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but they have no access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a trained hair stylist and makeup artist. She has been supplementing her family’s income by providing haircuts and selling cosmetics, lotions and gift items to locals. After graduating from the SBA entrepreneurial training course, Hanan decided to establish a beauty shop. In her area, there are no other salons and the request by locals is high. She is establishing her shop and selling cosmetics and beauty supplies along with gift items.

Hanan needed this loan to assist with purchasing a washing station, a sink, furniture, cosmetic supplies, hair styling instruments and beauty products.

Hanan wants to strengthen her family’s economic situation. She plans to expand into selling additional gift items, jewelry and other products.

loans.use: To purchase a washing station, a sink, furniture, cosmetic supplies, hair styling instruments and beauty products.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 67 years old, married to Rosemary and blessed with four children between 18 and 30 years old. He is in the transport business, a business he started a year ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 80,000 to purchase a motor bike. The profit he makes will help him repay his loan and meet his family’s needs. 

His dream is to see his business and his family prosper. This is his third loan.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike.

loans.name: Jesutogbe 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTOGBE 4 est formé de quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommé Emilienne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la septième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Emilienne est mariée à un certain Barnabé. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Emilienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Emilienne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Emilienne vend depuis une quinzaine d'année, des poissons frais, du haricot et divers autres produits à son domicile. Emilienne achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Emilienne désire augmenter son stock de produits. Pour ce faire, Emilienne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTOGBE 4, un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The JESUTOGBE 4 group consists  of four women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Emilienne, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. It is the seventh time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase its level of activity.

Emilienne is married to a man named Barnabé. Emilienne and Barnabé have four children, all in school and their dependents. Emilienne lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.  She has never attended school.

In order to cover her various expenses and for the past fifteen years or so, Emilienne has been selling fresh fish, beans, and various other goods, from her home. She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

Eager to better meet her customers' needs and in order to raise her income, Emilienne would like to increase her stock of products.  To this end, she is requesting a new loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the JESUTOGBE 4 group.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, beans, and various other goods.

loans.name: Angarag

texts.en:
Angarag is 44 years old and lives with her six children in a ger—the Mongolian word for a yurt (a type of dwelling)—in the Dornogovi province in Mongolia. All of her children are either in school or have completed school and have a professional certificate. Her husband recently died.

"It has been hard since my husband passed away," said this sharp and hardworking woman, "but I won't let it stop me from supporting my children."

Angarag started her sewing business in 1998. Her sewing skills are excellent, and she is well known around the neighborhood. Now that her children are growing up, they're supporting her sewing business. She's finally able to expand, but she lacks the equipment. Angarag is requesting 1000000 MNT to purchase a sewing machine and materials.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and materials.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is taking out another loan of Ksh 45,000 to expand her business. The last loan has helped her increase her monthly income, which has made her save, so she managed to construct a rental house. 

Mgeni thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support. With this loan, she plans to purchase coconuts for sale.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Lipcia Carolina

texts.es: Lipcia Carolina su actividad económica  es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que ya tiene cierta experiencia.  Ella ha demostrar en el transcurso del tiempo ser responsable, buena paga, trabajadora, y con solvencia moral, su rutina diaria es  levantarse  temprano a las 6 de la mañana y cierra su tienda a las 7 de la noche, y así proporcionar mejor servicio a sus clientes y de igual forma mejorar sus ingresos económicos. El financiamiento es para la  compra de perfumes, ropa interior, colonias, tratamientos para la piel , sabanas, calzado y ropa en genera.
texts.en:
Lipcia Carolina's business is the sale of general merchandise. This is not the first time she has taken out a loan, so she already has some experience. She has demonstrated over time that she is responsible, reliable in her payments, hardworking, and of good moral character. 

Her daily routine is to get up early, at 6:00 in the morning, and close her shop at 7:00 in the evening. This way, she provides better service to her customers and, at the same time, improves her income. 

This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, undergarments, colognes, skin care products, linens, footwear, and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, undergarments, colognes, skin care products, linens, footwear, and clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old. She is married with three children. She operates a barber shop as her primary business and she owns a retail shop. She has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by one of the field officers. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan to create another space to give room for a beauty salon.

She hopes to diversify her business and open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to create another space to give room for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a single woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She operates a food stall where she sells from her home mostly to local residents. She dreams of opening a shop in the future. She joined Yehu to get loans. Esther lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Food and school fees are her greatest monthly expenses. Credit defaulters are her major challenge. She intends to purchase rice, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat with the loan of KSH 50,000.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, es separada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de su madre ocupando cuatro habitaciones con pared de adobe, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos por la venta de más de ocho horas de verduras en el mercado, exponiéndose al frió o calor  ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo por que lo hace sentada encima de una acera en el piso, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar papas, cebollas, habas, lechuga, tomate, etc. Para mejorar sus ingresos ya que ella es la única que cubre los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos y estudios para sus hijos ya que tampoco cuenta con un seguro médico.
El sueño de Paulina, es tener su puesto de venta fijo para mejorar sus ingresos y poder solventar los gastos de estudios para sus hijos ya que están en secundaria y desean entrar a la universidad.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Paulina is separated from her husband and has two children. They live at her mother's house where they occupy four rooms with adobe walls. The house is located in the District of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz.

She currently generates income by selling vegetables at the market for more than eight hours. This exposes her to the cold and the heat since she does not have an established location. As a result, she ends up selling from the sidewalk while sitting on the ground. Paulina is requesting a loan to buy potatoes, onions, beans, lettuce, tomatoes, and other products in order to improve her earnings because she is the only one covering expenses such as food, basic utilities, and her children's studies. Paulina also does not have health insurance.

Her dream is to have an established vending post so that she can improve her income and provide for her children's education. They are currently in high school and want to enter the university. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, beans, lettuce, tomatoes, and other products.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Gregoria tiene 50 años tiene cuatro hijos que son dependientes de las edades de 8, 10, 13 y 16, su esposo el señor Enrique se encuentra en la localidad  San Julián trabajando como albañil. La Sra.  Gregoria vive en la zona Plan 3000, la señora se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzados de segunda mano hace aproximadamente diez años en diferentes ferias de la capital cruceña. El crédito solicitado es para aumentar su capital trabajo para comprar mercadería zapatos tenis y botas por fardo,   ya que disminuyo el capital que tenia a causa de una inversión que realizo para la construcción de la casa de su hijo, ya que continua ayudándole a  construir su casita, la Sra. Gregoria  es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 50, has four dependent children, ages 8, 10, 13, and 16.  Her husband Enrique is in the town of San Julián working as a bricklayer.  Gregoria lives in the Plan 3000 area.  She has sold used clothing and footwear for approximately 10 years in the different markets in the capital of Santa Cruz.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital buying merchandise--bundles of sneakers and boots.  She used some of the capital she had because of an investment she made to build her son's house

Gregoria is a kind and hardworking person.  She is grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy sneakers and winter boots.

loans.name: Pape Masse

texts.fr: Monsieur Pape Masse vit au Sénégal. C’est  un homme marié qui s’active dans le petit commerce et vends des produits saisonniers, bonbons et autres  petits produits alimentaires pour enfants. Il est responsable de la gestion des dépenses  de nourriture de son foyer. Il capitalise une expérience de 3 ans dans son activité. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa localité d’habitation. Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs dans l’objectif de se procurer des produits a revendre. Ce  financement pourra l’aider a réaliser des bénéfices plus intéressants  et ainsi parvenir a améliorer les conditions  alimentaires de sa famille. Son seul rêve  est de devenir un jour  commerçant  grossiste.
texts.en:
Pape Masse lives in Senegal.  He is a married man who is actively involved in retail and sells seasonal products, candy and other snacks for children.  At home, he is the one who manages food-related expenses.  He has a three-year experience in his field.

Pape Masse is a member of his local UIMCEC branch and has already repaid a previous loan.  He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for the purchase of goods he intends to resell.  With this loan, he will be able to make better profits, which will enable him to improve his family's diet.  His only dream is to become a wholesale merchant one day.

loans.use: to buy products for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old, married to Dominic and blessed with four children who are 35, 30, 23 and 20 years old. She owns a retail shop, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase five bales of baking flour, washing detergents and crates of sodas. 

Profit from her business will help her purchase additional stock. Her dream is to be a successful business lady in the future. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase baking flour, washing detergents and sodas.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman who has four children, none of whom attends school. She operates a café, which she has been running for the last five years. She also sells coconuts from her home. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and her primary customers are her neighbors. Mishi joined Yehu to get funds for her business.
 
With the loan of KSH 20,000, she will be able to purchase coconuts to sell and wheat flour and rice for her café.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
JOSE JAVIER  	tiene 23 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

JOSE JAVIER  trabaja en un departamento de estadística. Solicita el dinero para poder comprar cemento, bloque, varillas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar los arreglos de la casa. Las compras de los materiales los hará en Ventanas.

El sueño es poder comprarse un carro. El desafío al que se enfrenta es el mal clima.

En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir momentos con la familia, Salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Jose Javier is 23 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his mother in Ventanas, which is in Los Ríos Province.

Jose Javier works in a department of statistical studies. He is requesting a loan in order to buy cement, blocks, and rods. With the help of this loan, he will be able to make repairs to his house. These materials will be purchased in Ventanas. His dream is to be able to buy car. His greatest challenge is dealing with the bad weather.

In his free time, Jose Javier enjoys sharing moments with his family and going out for walks.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, and rods.

loans.name: Nora Griselda

texts.es:
Nora, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, todos dependientes, ella administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, lo atiende a tiempo completo, su horario es de 7:00am a 7:00pm, este negocio lo aprendió por su madre, hoy en día le ayuda a cubrirse muchos gastos. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la tienda como arroz, frijoles, embutidos, aceite, pan, huevos, esta compra le permitirá competir con más productos, atendiendo mejor la demanda.
La aspiración de Nora es Salir adelante con la educación de sus hijos y ofrecerles la alimentación y vivienda que necesitan.
texts.en:
Nora lives with her husband and three children, all dependent.  She manages a store selling convenience items.  She works full-time.  Her schedule is from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m.  She learned this business from her mother.  These days it helps her to cover a lot of expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the store such as rice, beans, sausage, oil, bread, and eggs.  This purchase will allow her to compete with more products and to better attend to the demand.

Nora's goal is to get ahead with her children's education and give them the food and shelter they need.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sausage, oil, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 58 years old and married. Their children are all grown-ups. She is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past ten years.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD since she was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow.

She hopes to be a renowned dairy farmer in her area.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is 28 years old. He is married and has three children aged eight, four, and two years. He is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past three years. He gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by one of his friends, who is a KADET client. He paid his loan well and in good time. He will use the loan to buy more chicks to rear for his business.

He hopes to open a restaurant so as to provide a ready market for his chicken.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to rear and sell later.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Carlos tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene ocho hijos. Él trabaja en la agricultura y fue su padre quien le enseño desde muy pequeño. Para comprar los insumos que necesita debe caminar a pie durante veinte minutos por unas veredas a la orilla de un río hasta llegar a la carretera, luego aborda un autobús que tarda unos diez minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde los compra.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 4 sacos de sulfato de amonio, 2 sacos de formula, pago de mano de obra por $220, para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Con la inversión Carlos comprara los insumos necesarios para sus cultivos de una sola vez, a demás tendrá dinero disponible para pagar mano de obra en el tiempo necesario, que le permita obtener una mejor cosecha. Él desea continuar trabajando, enseñar a sus hijos a cultivar y dar el ejemplo a la comunidad para que lo realicen de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old, married, and has 8 children. He is a farmer and was taught by his father when he was very young. To buy the farming supplies he needs, Carlos has to walk on foot 20 minutes from his fields on the shores of a river to arrive at the highway, then board a bus that takes 10 minutes to reach the store where he will purchase these supplies.

The loan he requests is for buying 4 sacks of ammonium sulfate, 2 sacks of formula, and, also, to pay workers $220 to plant 14,000 square meters of corn. With this investment, Carlos will buy the supplies necessary for his crops all at once, and will have the money to pay workers when the need arises, allowing him to grow a better harvest.  Carlos wishes to continue working, teaching his children how to farm, and providing an example to the community of how best to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of ammonium sulfate, 2 sacks of formula, and, also, to pay workers $220 to sew 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen has applied for his second loan from Kiva's partner, KADET. He plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs for his farm during this planting season. In the future, Stephen hopes to expand his farm and improve his farming methods to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 24 years old. He is married but does not have children yet. He sells second-hand clothes and has been in this business for the past six years.

This is his second loan from Kiva's partner, KADET, after being introduced by one of its field officers. He repaid his previous loan in good time. He will use this loan to purchase more clothes for resale.

He hopes to expand his business and own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a mother of two school-age children. She has operated a tailoring business from home for the past ten years. She aspires to open a tailoring and dressmaking college in the future. Lack of sufficient capital to expand the business is her major challenge and this motivated her to join Yehu to get financial support through loans. Mwanajuma lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Much of her monthly income is spent on food and rent.
With the loan of 70000 KES, she plans to purchase clothing materials.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su abuela, tienen casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de tropigas, distribuyendo gas propano,  tiene 6 años en el negocio, comenzó como empleado de la empresa y decidió ser vendedor instalando su propio negocio desde hace 3 años.
El quiere invertir un préstamo en la compra de gas, los cuales comprara al por mayor y distribuirá a la zona donde ya tiene clientela, este préstamo le ayudara para que Carlos realice la compra al mayoreo y fortalece el negocio.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio, pues sus ingresos depende de él además que su abuela tambien depende de su trabajo, así podrá ir mejorando su economía.
texts.en:
Carlos is 29 years old and lives with his grandmother in their own house.  He works selling Tropigas, distributing propane.  He has been in this business for six years.  He began as an employee of the company and decided to become a salesman, starting his own business three years ago.

He wants to invest his loan in the purchase of gas, which he will buy wholesale and distribute in the area where he already has clients.  This loan will help Carlos to complete the wholesale purchase and strengthen his business.

His objective is to maintain his business, since his income is totally dependent on his own work and his grandmother is also dependent on his work.  In this way he will improve his finances.

loans.use: to purchase propane gas.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christoper is a married man. He has a son who is four years old. He describes himself to be ambitious and outgoing. He operates a quarry where he sells pebbles, stones etc. He has been involved in this business for 12 years and employs eight staff members. His business is located at a potential residential area and his primary customers are contractors, schools, churches etc. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rainy season when roads are impassible to the business location. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a drill worth KES 50,000 and pay for labor of KES 30,000  In the past, Christoper has taken loans of KES 20,000, 40,000, 60,000 and 80,000, which he managed to pay well.  His business goal is to have his own lorry for transportation within five years. He hopes that in the future, he can buy a farm and buy dairy cows to raise.

loans.use: to buy a drill and pay for labor

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
Owen is married and blessed with two children. He sells second-hand furnishings and blankets. He has been in this business for the last six years and earns KES 36,600 per month.

He is applying for his fourth loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to buy second-hand clothes and bed covers to sell. 

He will use the extra profit to support the family. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes and bed covers.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is 51 years old and the widowed mother of eleven children. With the loan, Riziki will buy more rice, sugar, maize flour, and beans to sell. The profit from the business will be for savings.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is the mother of two children. She sells vegetables and has spent six years in the business. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, and leafy greens to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a married man. He has a son who is 1 year old. He describes himself to be honest, trustworthy and a go-getter man. He operates a retail store where he sells phone accessories and provides M-pesa (money) transactions. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located at a strategic business area and his primary customers are students. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent power blackouts. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy phone accessories and add float of M-pesa transactions . His business goal is to run many more similar retail stores within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable with a well established wholesale shop .

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories and add float to M-Pesa(money) transactions.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 43 years old. She is a mother of three children, all of whom go to school. She sells rice, sugar, and salt. She has been in the business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more stock to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a mother of two children, neither of whom is enrolled in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has been operating a clothing business where she sells clothes at the market to the general public. Nzadze has been doing this for the last four years, and she dreams of expanding the business and hiring employees. She joined Yehu to get financial support. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 
The loan of Ksh 30,000 will help her to purchase bundles of new clothes.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of new clothes.

loans.name: Fahamu

texts.en: Fahamu is a mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She operates a tendering business where she transports goods from one point to another destination i.e. she offers light transport services using her lorry. She has been in this business for the last three years, previously selling charcoal and firewood. Fahamu owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. She dreams of purchasing another lorry in the future. The high cost of fuel is her major challenge facing her business. Other sources of income include earnings from her husband. She joined Yehu to access some loans to boost her business. With the loan of KSH 40,000, she will be able to service her lorry.

loans.use: to service the lorry.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 56 years old, married and blessed with five children between 10 and 20 years old. Her spouse is a civil servant and supports her in meeting some of their financial needs. Ruth has been in the farming business for the last seven years. From this business she earns an average income of KES 8,000 per month.

Ruth has borrowed a loan of KES 61,000 from Kiva's partner, KADET. This is her sixth loan after successfully repaying her previous loans. She intends to use the whole amount to purchase farm inputs, among other items for her business. 

With the anticipated profits she intends to pay school fees for her children and expand her business. Her future plan is to buy dairy cows in order to diversify her sources of income and also give the best education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more farm inputs

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is 25 years old and single. He has been running a business selling bed sheets for the past two years. He wants a loan to buy more bed sheets to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is 38 years old. She has been a business woman for the past eight years, selling goats. The loan will be used to buy another goat. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 39 years old. She has three children who are between seven and seventeen years old. All of them attend school. Pelagie sells shoes. With the loan, Pelagie will buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for school fees.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes for resell.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a married woman with nine children, three of whom are in school. For the past ten years, she has been selling charcoal at the market. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her main goal is to open a charcoal depot in the future. Chari describes theft to be her major challenge and food to be her greatest monthly expense. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business. Other sources of income include money made by her children.
Chari plans to purchase a stock of charcoal to sell, using the loan of Ksh 40,000.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Iván, es soltero y no tiene hijos; vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo un habitación  pequeña y con el piso de tierra,  la casa esta ubicada en la zona Vino Tinto en la ciudad de La Paz.
Iván, estudió solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de ocho horas y bajo muchos riesgos de asalto o robo ya que lo hace hasta altas horas de la noche, es por eso que solicita el crédito para el arreglo del tren delantero de su vehiculo. También tiene ingresos del otro vehiculo que tiene,  el cual le da renta por día, con estos ingresos cubre los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia, ya que tampoco cuentan con seguro medico.
El sueño de Iván, es poder independizarse para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Iván is single and has no children. He lives at the home of his parents and occupies a small room with a dirt floor. The house is located in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz.

Iván only has a high school education, so he currently works as a driver for more than eight hours. Since he works into the late hours of the evening, he runs the risk of being assaulted or robbed. He is requesting a loan in order to repair the front part of his vehicle. Iván also generates income from another vehicle that he owns and rents out each day. With all of his income, he is able to cover the cost of food and basic utilities for his family. Iván does not have health insurance.

His dream is to become independent so that he can improve his quality of life. This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Priscilah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a farmer in the Nkubu area and a mother of one child who is thirteen years old. She runs her farm with the help of two farmhands and sells her milk, maize and beans to the local market. She also works as a lab technician in a local dispensary.

Priscillah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a water pump and pigs. She says the water pump will mitigate the challenge of water supply on the farm and improve crop production. She plans to buy a bigger parcel of land to expand her farm.

She says the major challenges are pests and diseases and recurrent crop failure due to insufficient rain.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and piglets.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is thirty-seven and lives with her family of three children aged between thirteen and ten. She lives in Nkubu, in Central Kenya, where she grows bananas, maize, beans and milk. She sells them in the local market to meet her family's needs.

Jane has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She plans to use the income to educate her three children as well as to start a cereal retail business in the local market to supplement her farming income.

She is worried about the challenges that pests and diseases pose to the crop production, especially before harvest.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Ana Maria nació en la ciudad de Cusco del departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos. La socia Ana Maria es profesional en económica y trabaja en una entidad pública. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este trabajo  y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. 

La socia Ana Maria también trabaja de forma independiente haciendo proyectos económicos entonces ella requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de escritorio como por ejemplo hojas, cuadernnos, lapiceros y otros cosas más.  
  
La socia Ana Maria pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a member who was born in the city of Cusco, Department of Cusco, and still lives in this beautiful city. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children. Ana Maria is a professional economist and works for a public entity. She has been in this job for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Ana also works as an independent consultant on economics projects. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy office supplies such as sheets of paper, notebooks, ballpoint pens, and other items. She is a member of the San Antonio Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco Province.

loans.use: to buy office supplies such as sheets of paper, notebooks, ballpoint pens, and other items.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius has been in farming for five years and currently grows and sells maize and beans in the local market. In addition to farming, he works as a carpenter. He is married with one child aged three years.

Pius has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to help him buy poultry birds and pigs at 15,000 KES each. He wants to venture into poultry and pig farming and believes he will be able to grow the two businesses and eventually buy a dairy cow.

He says Juhudi Kilimo loans are affordable compared to other financial institutions.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident of Nkubu and has had ten years in mixed farming. He currently grows maize and beans and produces milk, which all go to the local markets. He is married with one child, aged seven, who is in school. He earns additional income from masonry.

David has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He says this will expand his farming business, spread his risks and improve his family's living standards.

He complains of insufficient rain.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Gitari

texts.en:
Gitari has been in active farming for twenty years in his rural home in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He grows fruit, vegetables and coffee which he sells at the local market to earn income for his family. He earns additional income from his retail shop.

Gitari has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy goat for 20,000 KES and irrigation pipes for 20,000 KES. He says he will be able to pay for the education of his children and improve the living standards of the entire family.

Gitari likes Juhudi Kilimo's client assessment processes used before disbursing loans.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself to be an aggressive entrepreneur. He operates a motorcycle with which he provides transportation services. In addition, he is a farmer. He has been involved in this business for 1 year and employs 2 staff members. His business is located within a shopping center and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high maintenance costs of his motorcycle. 

He will use this KES 80,000 loan to buy a dairy cow worth KES 45,000 and a chaff cutter worth KES 35,000 for cutting grass for the cows. Peter had previously taken out a loan of KES 80,000 which he finished repaying well. His business goal is to buy more motorbikes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will invest his profits by buying vans.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and a chaff cutter

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam operates a tailoring business in Nakuru. She used her previous loan to buy more textile materials for use in her business. She was able to buy and it was very profitable. She repaid the loan well and in good time.

This will be her second loan and she plans to use the amount to buy more textiles to be able to meet her customers' needs and demands. In the future, Miriam hopes to grow her business and supply textile materials to other tailoring businesses, and hence make more income and be able to provide good living standards for her family.

loans.use: to add to her stock of textiles for sale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya and has been in farming for over thirty years. He currently runs his farm with the help of two farmhands. His farm produces fish, fruits and vegetables which are sold locally. He gets additional income from an employment pension.

Christopher has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to educate his last born child and improve the family's living standards. 

Christopher says a lack of farming knowledge is usually the main challenge and advocates for more training. He appreciate Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he lives with his family of ten children. The oldest seven are adults and the youngest three are still in school. His farm produces milk, maize, and beans. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand.

Jacob has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank, water pipes and poultry birds at 20,000 KES each. He plans to buy more parcels of land for better farming.

Jacob says the major challenge in farming is insufficient rain.

loans.use: To buy a water tank, irrigation pipes and poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís, estudió hasta técnico medio y trabaja como empleado más de ocho horas en una empresa privada en la ciudad de La Paz. El trabajo que realiza Luís, es peligroso ya que realiza el trabajo de conexiones de líneas telefónicas y tiene que subirse a los postes de energía eléctrica.
Luís, es soltero y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en dos habitaciones pequeñas en la casa de sus familiares en la zona Chasquipampa de la ciudad de La Paz.
 El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que con eso se transporta a su trabajo por la distancia donde vive.
El sueño de Luís, es mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida para comprarse una casa y darle más comodidad a su hijo ya que se encuentra en etapa escolar.
Luís, trabaja por primera vez  junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Luís studied for a technical degree and now works more than eight hours at a private company in the city of La Paz. His work is dangerous because his job requires that he go under power lines in order to examine telephone line connections. Luís is single and has one child. They live in two small rooms at the house of some relatives in the District of Chasquipampa in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to maintain his vehicle that he uses for traveling the distance between his job and his home.

Luís dreams of improving his income and his quality of life so that he can buy a house and provide greater comfort for his son who is of school age. This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the vehicle he uses to get to work.

loans.name: Serena Group

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her 40s, is married with three children who go to school. She has been a food vendor for three years. She works from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to pay school fees and household expenses, and restock the missing items in her food business. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy and make more food. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.
  
She will share this loan with her loan group "Serens" who has 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy and make more food.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid 30s, is married with four children. Three of them go to school. She has many items to sell: water, soda, juice, cakes, vitenge and sarongs. She has been in this business for nine years. She works from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to build a small house, buy items missing in her business, and pay school fees. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to buy more water, juice, soda, cakes, vitenge and sarongs. Her dream is to one day be able to build more rooms in her house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Tupendane," which has a total of 11 members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more water, juice, soda, cakes, vitenge and sarongs.

loans.name: Haminton Antonio

texts.es:
Haminton, trabaja en la agricultura y en una comercial, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijas de 6 y 8 años de edad, tienen casa propia, tiene 8 años de trabajar en una comercial como vendedor de productos de primera necesidad.
El solicita un préstamo porque está queriendo mejorar las instalaciones de su vivienda  comprara laminas, hierro, cemento y pago de mano de obra, con esta ayuda mejorara la casa donde habita con su familia, pues el invierno está por iniciar y quiere que estén más seguros. 
La aspiración de Haminton, es que su familia este en una vivienda digna, con seguridad, por eso espera trabajar para ofrecerles un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Haminton works in agriculture and also in the commercial arena. He is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters, who are 6 and 8 years old, in their own home. He has worked for 8 years selling essential goods and products. He is requesting this loan because he wants to make improvements to his home, buying metal roofing, iron, cement and payment for labor. With the help from the loan he will improve the house where his family lives and with the winter approaching he wants them to be safe. Haminton's aspiration is that his family lives in a dignified home, in safety and so he hopes to work to give them a better future.

loans.use: purchase metal roofing, iron, cement and payment for laborers.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en: Meali is taking out another loan of KES 100,000 to expand her existing business and start a charcoal, firewood, and water selling business. Since the last loan, her monthly income has increased and she is progressing well. The loan allowed her to accrue some money and she is now starting two more businesses. Her children are getting a quality education from better schools. With the loan, she plans to purchase more charcoal and firewood, and also vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and firewood, and also vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from Kiva's partner, MCDT-SACCO, to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to see her business grow into a whole sale business and to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Philister

texts.en: Philister is a married woman who has four children, all of whom are attending school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She has been operating a food stall from her home for the past five years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her main aim is to open a hotel and hire some employees. Philister describes the high cost of commodities as her major challenge. She joined Kiva's partner, Yehu, to access loans. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and food for her family. Philister intends to purchase wheat flour, rice, and cooking fat using this loan of KES 50,000.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, and cooking fat
