loans.name: Mchakato Group

texts.en:
Mayasa, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children, all of whom go to school.  She runs several businesses, in food vending and fruit sales.  She has been in business for 10 years now.  She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mayasa's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy furniture, to buy more food for resale, and to start selling fruit.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her stock of food and fruit and to make bricks.  Her dream is to be able to build her own house one day.

Mayasa will share this loan with her loan group "Mchakato," which has a total of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food and fruit and to make bricks.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika is a 47-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She plans to start a small business raising pigs for sale. Monika needs a loan to buy a fence. She will use her profits to improve her business. Monika joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fence for her pig business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 32-year-old married woman with six children. She cooks and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Maria needs a loan to buy an oven, chicken leg quarter, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce and onions. She plans to use her profits to pay her children's school fees. Maria has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow her restaurant.

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: Etevise is a 43-year-old married woman with seven children. She grows and sells vegetables in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Etevise needs a loan to purchase some new equipment and more seeds. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. Etevise has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and seeds.

loans.name: Vaeluaga

texts.en: Vaeluaga is a 48-year-old woman with four children. She grows and sells taro in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Vaeluaga needs a loan to pay her kids' fees. For extra income, she also makes and sells pancakes. She plans to use her profits to expand the business. Vaeluaga has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and more taro.

loans.name: Sonia Beatriz

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, tienen casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta en una taquería y pupuseria, desde hace dos años está en el negocio, lo inicio principalmente por el apoyo de su esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo, porque necesita fortalecer el negocio, comprando la mercadería que es necesaria para la producción de tacos y pupusas, como el aceite, condimentos, carne, maíz, bebidas, entre otros que son parte de la preparación de los platillos, esto le ayudara para mejorar sus ingresos y ofrecer mejor calidad de producto a sus clientes.
La aspiración de Sonia es a futuro poder crecer con otro nuevo negocio, en otro punto de la zona, para poderse desarrollar y mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en: Sonia lives with her husband and three children, they have their own home and she has worked at a taquería (a place that sells tacos) and pupuseria (a place that sells pupusa- a primarily Salvadoran dish made with a thick hand made tortilla) for two years which she started primarily to support her husband. She is asking for a loan because she needs to make her business stronger, purchasing merchandise that is needed to make tacos and pupusas like oil, condiments, meat, corn, and drinks, among other items that are needed to make these dishes. This will help her improve her earnings and offer a better quality product to her customers. Sonia's aspiration is that she will be able to grow her business in the future at a different location in order to improve her conditions.

loans.use: purchase oil, condiments, meat, corn and drinks.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 27 years old. She is married with one child who is 3.5 years old. Her husband sells truck tires. She sells clothes such as trousers and sweaters for both kids and adults. With the requested loan, she wants to buy more trousers and sweaters for resale. She plans to use the profits to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes such as sweaters and trousers for resale.

loans.name: Costique

texts.en: Costique is 33 years old. He has two children between 3 and 7 years old. He sells utensils and has spent 7 years in this business. He has decided to get a loan to buy more utensils for resale such as sauce pans, and forks. He plans to use the profits to reinvest in his business. In the future, he would like to get better business.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for sale

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.ru: Абдуллочон женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Сын является студентом, а дочка учится в школе. Жена работает в детском саду медсестрой, она имеет 18 летний стаж работы. Более 16 лет Абдуллочон занимается торговлей орг.техники и бытовой техники на центральном рынке. Имеет арендованный магазин в центре города. Хорошо управляет бизнесом и успешен в своей сфере деятельности. Имеет постоянных покупателей, а также имеет поставщиков, которые предоставляют ему товар. Абдуллочон хотел бы получить займ для покупки орг.техники и бытовой техники для увлечения товарооборота. Абдуллочон имеет хорошую репутация и кредитную историю. Абдуллочон надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en:
Abdullojon is married and a dedicated father of two children. His son studies at a university while his daughter attends school. Abdullojon's wife has worked 18 years as a nurse in a daycare. Abdullojon, himself, rents a small store at the local market where he has sold household appliances for the past 16 years. He successfully manages his business and has regular clients and suppliers. 

Abdullojon would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase some household appliances to increase his goods turnover. He has a good reputation and credit history. He hopes for your help and compassion.

loans.use: To buy household appliances.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married with four children. She is 43 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban.
Sofia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Sofia has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 13,000 to purchase additional pig feed. 
Sofia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Sofia hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional pig feed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with three children--all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. Rose has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy beef, rice, chicken, bananas and utensils. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She hopes to see her business grow into a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house.  She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more beef, rice, chicken, bananas and utensils.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is taking out another loan of Ksh 25,000 to start a new clothing business. She also wants to stabilize her salon. With the previous loan, she was able to increase her profits which enabled her to start this new business. She plans to purchase bundles of clothes and beauty items for her salon. Anna aspires to expand her pub business and hire more employees.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and beauty items for her salon.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a mother of three children, all adults. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. She has been selling firewood and charcoal to hotel operators for the last six years. Millicent dreams of opening a cereal shop in the future. She describes food to be her greatest monthly expense, and high transportation costs to be her major challenge.
With the loan of Ksh 20,000, she intends to purchase firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mti-Pesa Group

texts.en:
Nickson, who is in his late 30s, is marrried with three children, two of whom go to school. He has been selling domestic tools, such as cups, glasses, and plates, for nine years now.  He works from 10:00 am to 4:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nickson's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the prevous loans to restock items and for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more domestic tools for resale.  His dream is to be able to open a shop for his business one day.

Nickson will share this loan with his loan group, Mti-Pesa, which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more domestic tools for resale

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is 36 years old. She lives in a small village in the Kakheti District, East Georgia, with her family: her husband Temur, her 18-year-old daughter, and her 15-year-old son. Elene’s daughter is a student. Her son goes to school. Temur works as a night watchman at a local private company. Elene leads the family's agricultural business. They have a small vineyard, and Temur sells grapes in the village. The family's total average monthly income is 200 Georgian laris (GEL). According to Credo estimates, the family falls in the subsistence-poor category.

Elene requested credit to start up a new agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing credit to start-ups and re-startups with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low income. Elene will use her loan to purchase and raise 15-17 calves, who will be placed in an old cattle shed in her yard. After half a year, she will sell the grown calves for a higher price and get the profit. For the first 2 cycles of her new business, Elene will reinvest most of the profit to increase her turnover. This will enable the family to increase their income and thereby combat poverty. In addition, in the future, the family will have enough income to access the regular credit products available in the country’s capital market in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Malan

texts.en:
Malan is a 24-year-old single man in the business of selling spare car parts. He started this business five years ago and earns a monthly income of 10000 KES. 

He has requested a loan of 10000 KES to purchase more spare car parts for sale. The anticipated profit will contribute toward him opening up his own garage. 

He dreams of being a millionaire in the year 2030. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more spare car parts to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 38 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married with two children.

Imelda is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living; she has been doing this for five years. Imelda has requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase additional feed for raising livestock.

Imelda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for raising livestock.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 50 years old and is from Lucsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow and blessed with 5 children. Josephine works in an agricultural business project raising domestic animals (primarily pigs) to earn an income. She has been in this business for 6 years and earns about 4,200 per month. Recently, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services from the cooperative as additional investment of her existing business raising pigs for sale. She requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase feeds for her domestic pigs for their growth and good nourishment. Josephine plans to reinvest the income generated from her loan back into the business and ultimately hopes to expand the size of the business. Additionally, Josephine hope that continued success in her business will allow her to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her domestic pigs for their growth and good nourishment.

loans.name: Celfida Del Carmen

texts.es: Celfida del Carmen  esta emprendedora se dedica a la venta de tiste y frijoles cocidos, es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, jefa de familia que tiene que velar por el sustento de sus hijos,  en la actualidad ella ha adquirido experiencia  en su negocio ya que es su herramienta de trabajo, Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que llegan a solicitarle sus productos. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de leña, frijoles, tistes, bolsas, maíz entre otros productos.
texts.en: Celfida del Carmen is an enterprising woman who makes a living selling tiste, a traditional drink made from cacao beans, and cooked beans.  She is a very hard-working woman, is responsible, and is the head of the family who has to ensure the livelihoods of her children.  At present, she has acquired experience in her business because it is her means of work.  She has a great variety of clients that come to ask for her products.  She asks for this loan to buy firewood, beans, tistes, bags, and corn, among other products.

loans.use: to buy firewood, beans, tistes, bags, and corn among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cows for breeding.

loans.name: Preciosa's Group

texts.en:
Preciosa is 66 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 6 children. 
Preciosa has a dressmaking business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to be used for purchasing clothes and other sewing accessories for her business. 
Preciosa has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Preciosa hopes to establish her own dress shop. Preciosa is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing materials and sewing accessories for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has no children. She is 50 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.
Alma make and sells “pulvoron”(a type of heavy, soft and very crumbly Spanish shortbread) to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional ingredients for her pulvoron making and selling business.
Alma has been a member of PMPC for almost 8 years. In the future, Alma hopes to market her product to other places.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional ingredients for pulvoron making and selling business

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José, solicita un préstamo, porque quiere surtirlo de productos frescos como tomates, cebollas, chiles, papas, aguacates, entre otros que son necesarios para su negocio y poder atraer nuevos clientes.
Su efecto con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, aumento sus ganancias y ha logrado tener la fuente de trabajo que le permite cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a loan because he wants to stock his business with fresh produce such as tomatoes, onions, chilis, potatoes and avocados, among other items that are necessary for his business and to bring in new customers.

The effect of his previous loan was positive. He increased his income and was able to keep a good flow of work that enabled him to cover his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, chilis, potatoes and avocados.

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia, se dedica a la venta de perfumes, vive con su madre y sus hermanas, la casa en la que residen es familiar, desde hace dos años se dedica al negocio de la venta de perfumes, trabajando con varias empresas como AVON.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como lo es perfumes en varias presentaciones, pues su intensión es mantener en el negocio una variedad para mejorar su oportunidad de ventas y de ganancias.
La aspiración de Patricia es crecer en el negocio e instalar un local donde pueda ofrecer a todos los clientes lo necesario.
texts.en:
Patricia works selling perfume. She lives with her mother and her sisters. The house they live in is owned by their family. For two years she has worked selling perfume, working with various companies such as Avon.

She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise, such as perfumes in various forms. She intends to carry a variety of products in her business to improve her opportunity for sales and income.

Patricia's goal is to expand her business and set up a store where she can offer her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Sintya

texts.es:
Sintya, es madre soltera y tiene una hija pequeña, se dedica a la venta y flete de joyas de oro por más de diez horas al día, es el único ingreso que tiene para mantener a su hija ya que paga todos los gastos de alimentación y gastos médicos ya que tampoco cuenta con un seguro medico.
Sintya, no tiene muchas comodidades pues  vive en una habitación de ladrillo y el piso de tierra en la casa de sus padres en la zona Pura pura de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más joyas ya sean anillos, aretes, collares, dijes etc. Para posteriormente ponerlas a la venta y aumentar sus ingresos.
El sueño que tiene Sintya, es mejorar su calidad de vida y darle más comodidad y seguridad a su hija.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Sintya is a single mother with a young daughter. She spends more than 10 hours a day selling and renting out gold jewelry. This is the only source of income by which she is able to support her daughter and pay for all expenses such as food and medical care. Sintya does not have health insurance. She does not have many comforts living at her parents' home in a room made of brick and with a dirt floor. The house is located in the District of Pura Pura in the city of La Paz.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more jewelry such as rings, earrings, necklaces, charms, and other items so that she can sell them later and increase her income. Sintya dreams of improving her quality of life and providing more comfort and security for her daughter. This is the first time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, rings, charms, and other items.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn is a 20-year-old resident of Mailen, Clarin. She provides for her 2 children's needs from the little amount of 3,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business, which she has had for 3 years as an aid to the income gained by her husband. However, just this year she become a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan at GDMPC microfinance of 5,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Manilyn wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Crisby

texts.en:
Crisby is married with 3 children. He is 44 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Crisby is a farmer and grows coconuts and corn to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years. He has requested a loan of 15000 PHP to be used to purchase fertilizers for his corn production activity. 

Crisby has been a member of PMPC for just a year. In the future, Crisby hopes to acquire more agricultural land.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for his corn production activity

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is 34 years old and a married woman with 4 children aged between 9 and 15. Her husband is a farmer. Julia runs a sari-sari store business. She sells various items like eggs, coffee, sugar, vinegar and toiletries. Aside from the store, she also raises pigs and sells fresh fish to her community. She works hard to provide for her family's needs and sustain her children's education. She requested a loan to purchase pig feed and more merchandise to sell such as canned goods. Julia hopes to elevate her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and more merchandise to sell such as canned goods

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is married with 3 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Lumbayao,Tampilisan Zamboanga del Norte.

Emerita owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Emerita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en: Marcelo is from Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old and married with four children. To make a living, Marcelo manufactures and sells specially manufactured products such as baskets to local businesses and community members. Marcelo has been engaged in his business for 4 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. Marcelo joined GDMPC in 2004. Marcelo is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna runs a fishing business with her husband in Trinidad, Bohol. She works hard to feed their 5 children and sustain their education. She requested a loan to purchase a boat engine. This loan will help bring in more fish for Lorna to sell. She hopes for their profits to increase and for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita is single. She is 60 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Pablita used her last loan to purchase fertilizer for her farmland. Her business is profitable, and she's asking for a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is 53 years old and married with 6 children. He resides in Sebasi of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Roberto operates an agriculture venture. He plants and harvests corn to sell in the local community in order to earn a living. He has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2008, Roberto joined GDMPC. In the future, Roberto would like to save in order to create an emergency fund for the future and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Mutalim

texts.ru: Муталим женат и на воспитании имеет одну дочку. Чтобы содержать свою семью  он занимается предоставлением перемалыванию пшеницы на мельнице. Дома имеет мельницу. Кроме этого занимается скотоводством. Его жена занимается предоставлением услуг портнихи. Муталим имеет много постоянных клиентов и хорошую репутация. Муталим запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Mutalim is married and he is raising one daughter.  In order to support his family, he provides such services as grinding wheat, from home, with a grinding mill.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  His wife provides dressmaking services.  Mutalim has many loyal customers and enjoys a good reputation.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle, which will allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is from the city of Gango Ozamz City. She is forty-six years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, Leoniza owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products, such as food for snacks, cooking oil, sugar, salt, noodles, etc., to the local community. She used to display her products at her house if there is no class since she sell at the school canteen. Leoniza has been in business for five years and earns PHP 10,000 a month. 

In 2004, Leoniza joined GDMPC. Leoniza is requesting a loan of PHP 14,700 which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Nieves Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal VIRGEN DE LAS NIEVES; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Juana Vilma tiene 74 años, viuda y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual mediante este ella sale adelante por su familia, la socia cocina diversos platos de comida como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante y continuar trabajando.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como arroz y aceite.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de compra y venta de zapatos, venta de artesania, costureria, alquiler de maquinas de construcción, cevicheria y venta de comida.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Juana Vilma is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Las Nieves"; this communal bank is located in the district of Wanchaq in the province of Cusco of the Cusco region.  

Juana Vilma, 74, is a widow and has four children.  She alternates her activities between her daily tasks and her restaurant business which is located in her own home.  She has had this business for years and with it she and her family have gotten ahead.  She cooks a variety of dishes such as rice with chicken, Peruvian steak and potatoes stir-fry, and soups among other things.  She is a very happy and responsible person eager to get ahead and continue working. 

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for the preparation of food such as rice and oil. 

The other members of the communal bank make their living buying and selling shoes, selling crafts, as a seamstress, renting construction machinery, selling sea food, and selling food. 

She is grateful for the intermediary that facilitates this loan and she agrees to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of food such as rice and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Each month, he earns 6000 PHP doing this farming. Nestor works hard to keep his farm productive. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Nestor hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. He also hopes to have sufficient income to sustain his child's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood that is necessary for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Nolasco

texts.en: Nolasco is 43 years old and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has had a beauty parlor for 10 years. He earns about 15000 PHP per month with his business. Nolasco works hard to provide the best service to his community. He has requested a loan to buy scissors, hair treatment essentials, and other beauty products. Nolasco hopes to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy scissors, hair treatment essentials, and other beauty products

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en:
Asenati is a 72-year-old widowed woman with 14 children. 

She would like to start growing taro crops to earn a living. Asenati has requested a loan to purchase supplies for growing taro. She will also use part of her loan to build her house. 

She has been a member of SPBD for 4 years. Asenati will spend her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and taro crops

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 43 years old and lives in Lupagan,Clarin. She is married with 3 children. 

Carol has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc. 

Carol has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Carol hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap and beverages

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic of Cento Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental has supported the needs of her family by providing construction supplies for 8 years and earns 1,000 PHP a month. She’s a 32-year-old mother and wife of a farmer who tries her best to earn on her own. For the time being, she’s in need of money so she applied for a loan of 1,800 PHP to buy more construction supplies for her business. Thanks to GDMPC microfinance for meeting such needs. Marivic desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesus

texts.es:
Guadalupe, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos para el comedor, aceite, verduras, condimentos, carnes, pollo, además reparara una plancha de hacer tortillas.
Ella considera que con estos préstamos se le han facilitado los medios para hacer crecer el negocio, teniendo una mayor variedad en el negocio y mejorando la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Guadalupe is requesting a new loan in order to buy products for her eatery such as oil, vegetables, condiments, meats, and chicken.  In addition, she wants to repair her griddle used for making tortillas.  She believes the loans have facilitated the growth of her business, helped her to offer greater variety in her business, and improved her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and to pay for repairs to her griddle.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo para darle mantenimiento al negocio, comprara un pedido maya para cercar la granja de pollos, con esto podrá aumentar el espacio y que estén los pollos mas seguros, considera que esta creciendo poco apoco con su granja.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue muy bueno, obtuvo 40 quintales de maíz 6 de frijoles, con esto ha logrado tener para la alimentación de la familia y poder vender, espera seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan to pay for farm maintenance.  She will buy metal mesh to enclose the chicken coop so she can increase the space and the chickens will be safer.  She believes her farm is growing little by little.

The effect of the first loan was very good.  She harvested 40 quintals of corn, six of beans and this has enabled her to feed the family and sell the rest.  She hopes to continue expanding.

loans.use: To buy metal mesh for a fence.

loans.name: Floribelia

texts.es:
Floribelia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el  negocio, pues estos préstamo son mucha ayuda para crecer, ella comprara telas, ciper, botones, hilos, además le dará mantenimiento a las maquinas de coser.
Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior ha logrado tener mucha ayuda en el negocio, compro insumos para el taller y esto le permite mejorar su atención a los clientes, ella sigue trabajando con mucho empeño para salir las necesidades del hogar, tomando contratos para elaborar uniformes escolares.
texts.en:
Floribelia is requesting a new loan for her business and plans to buy fabrics, zippers, buttons, thread, and also pay for maintenance for her sewing machines.  These loans have been very helpful in growing her business.

She believes the previous loan was very helpful because she was able to buy supplies for her workshop and that allowed her to improve customer service.  She continues working hard to provide everything necessary for her household.  Now she is taking orders for school uniforms.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread and pay for sewing machine maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir en el negocio, comprara un quintal de azúcar, jabón, detergentes, para surtir el negocio, estos productos los adquirirá al por mayor, para tener un mejor margen de ganancia.
Con el préstamo anterior logro invertir en el negocio y le dio mejores ganancias, pagando puntual el crédito, sus núcleo familiar se mantiene, los ingresos a través del préstamo ha mejorado su situación familiar.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan for her business.  She plans to buy a quintal of sugar, soap, and detergents to restock her store.  She will buy these items wholesale in order to obtain a greater profit margin.

With the previous loan she was able to invest in her business, earn more profit and pay back the loan on time.  The income facilitated by the loan has allowed her to improve her situation and keep the family together.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 66 años de edad, es madre de  6 hijos, y socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años. Se dedica a la venta de artesanía y a la crianza de animales pequeños como gallinas y cuyes. Se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros, le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal porque ahí  aprendió a invertir de manera adecuada su dinero. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus artesanías como hilos y tintes, y también lo invertirá en la crianza de sus animales.
texts.en: Leonarda is a member of the communal bank "Alondras".  She is 66, has six children, and has been a member of FINCA Perú for 15 years.  She sells crafts and raises small animals such as hens and guinea pigs.  She is proud of everything she has been able to do with her savings.  She enjoys the training she receives through the communal bank, where she learned how to invest her money wisely.  The loan she is requesting is to buy materials for her crafts, such as threads and dyes.  She will also invest in her animal raising business.

loans.use: To buy threads and dye to make crafts.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 años. Ella es enfermera y es dueña de dos vehículos. Se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros  y le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que ahí aprendió a como hacer una inversión adecuada en su negocio. Su meta es comprar 2 vehículos más y formar su propia empresa de transportes. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de sus vehículos.
texts.en: Carolina is a member of the communal bank "Alondras".  She is 32, married, has two children, and has been a member of FINCA Perú for six years.  She is a nurse and owns two vehicles.  She is proud of everything she has done with her savings, and enjoys the training she receives through the communal bank, where she learned to invest her money wisely.  Her goal is to buy two more vehicles and set up a transportation company.  The loan is to pay for maintenance of the vehicles she has.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance for her two transport vehicles.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 47 ans veuve, mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 22 et 27 ans, tous vont à l'école. Elle exerce une activité de commerce en détail où elle vend des vivres  frais et secs (elle tranforme le manioc en farine et découpe les légumes) dans un marché de la place. Elle aimerait agrandir son activité en achetant les produits de transformation (manioc et légumes) en grande quantité, çalui évitera les ruptures de stocks qu'elle a tout le temps. ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille nombreuse dont elle a la charge et avec le temps, d'agrandir son  fond de commerce.
texts.en: Marie is a 47-year old widow, who is mother to four children ranging from 22 to 27 years old; all the children are studying. She has a retail trading activity, where sells fresh and dried food (she makes cassava flour from fresh cassava and cuts vegetables) in a local market. She would like to expand her activity by buying a large quantity of products (cassava and vegetables) to transform into food, as this will allow her to avoid running out of stock all the time. The profits will allow her to not only satisfy her already growing customer base but also to increase her profits. The profits will allow her to provide for the needs of her large family, which she takes care of, and, in time, grow her working capital.

loans.use: to buy cassava and vegetables in large quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase audiovisual products for resale

loans.name: Siti Halima

texts.en:
People in her neighborhood call this entrepreneur Ibu Halima.  She owns a shop in Tangerang, Indonesia that sells a lot of goods such as snacks, mineral water, soda drinks, soaps, shampoos, and last but not least pulsa (prepaid mobile phone credits).  Ibu Halima joined Ruma's network back when Ruma was still a small social enterprise, and she became the first Rekan Usaha (business partner) to Ruma.  

Being one of the oldest Ruma's Rekan Usaha is the main reason why she wants to become a Loket Ruma bill payment service agent.  In addition to that, she also wants to expand her business and her knowledge of entrepreneurship.  With the Loket Ruma business, her prediction is that people will come to see her to pay the electricity bill and buy prepaid electrical service vouchers, and to make installment payments for motorcycles.

With four children (ages 19, 16, 9, and 6) to support on her shop's income, by becoming a Loket Ruma agent, she is hoping that the income from her three businesses (the shop, pulsa sales, and the Loket Ruma service) will increase and enable her to pay her children's tuition until the four of them graduate from college.

loans.use: To pay a deposit on an electronic data capture device for her bill pay service business

loans.name: Yusrida

texts.en:
Ibu Yusrida is one of Ruma's RU (Rekan Usaha, or business partner) in North Bogor, West Java, Indonesia.  She lives with her husband, Sidik, and two children ages 14 and 9.  Ibu Yusrida and her husband own a warung (shop) that sells basic goods such as: rice, cooking oil, instant noodles, candies, soaps, shampoos, syrups, pulsa (prepaid mobile phone credits), and other items.

She's been a micro-entrepreneur for quite some time.  Her husband and her see this opportunity to build and expand the business to become a payment point and get more customer that they can serve.  She is expecting that people will come to her warung and pay their electricity bill, buy prepaid electricity credits, or pay motorcycle installments.  

In the end, she really hopes that with this new business line she will grow the business and generate more income for the family, so the family's living standards could actually increase.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, es soltera y tiene dos hijos que estudian en secundaria, viven en casa propia y ocupan solo tres habitaciones pequeñas, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente obtiene ingresos ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa y joyas todos los días y por más de diez horas ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para ayudar a su familia y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y gastos médicos ya que no cuenta con ningún seguro. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de más ropa y joyas para aumentar sus ingresos 
El sueño que tiene Maria, es construir más habitaciones para brindarles más comodidad a sus hijos, mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
María is single and has two children who are high school students. They live in their own home which consists of only three small rooms. María resides in the District of Pampahasi in the city of La Paz. She currently generates income by selling clothes and jewelry. María works every day for more than 10 hours since this is her only source of income by which she can support her family. With what little she earns, María is able to pay for expenses such as food, education, and medical care since she does not have insurance. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothing and jewelry, which will increase her earnings.

María dreams of building additional rooms so that she can provide greater comfort for her children and improve their quality of life. She also wants to improve her income so that she can pay for her children's education. This is the first time she has requested a loan form IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mahoudjlo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUDJLO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Rahamatou, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Rahamatou est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain Atti. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rahamatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins tout en apportant une aide à son mari dans les charges de la maison, Rahamatou mène comme activité la vente de l'igname de façon ambulante. Rahamatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Rahamatou désire obtenir un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUDJLO. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHOUDJLO group is made up of three people who live in the same area. The group representative, called Rahamatou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the fourth time the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé in order to grow their business. Rahamatou is 42 years old and married to a man named Atti. They have five children, all attending school and living at home. Rahamatou lives with her husband and children, and covers the household costs together with her husband. In order to meet her own needs while helping her husband with the household expenses, Rahamatou works as a mobile yam seller. Rahamatou buys her supplies in a market in Benin. 
In order to increase her stock of merchandise and to better meet her customers' demand, Rahamatou is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDé, together with the other members of the MAHOUDJLO group. The previous loans have all been repaid.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of yams.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José, solicita un  nuevo préstamo, pues quiere seguir creciendo comprara cubrecamas, almohadas, ventiladores, ropa variada, esto le ayudara para que su negocio se mantenga competente.
Su intensión es que este negocio progrese, con el anterior logro aumentar sus ganancias para que hasta hoy se mantenga en el mercado, sus ingresos para los gastos familiares  y personales han mejorado.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he wants to continue growing. He will buy comforters, pillows, fans, and various types of clothing. This will help him remain competitive in his business. His intention is to make progress in his business.

With his previous loan, José was able to increase his earnings and today he is still in the market. His income for covering family and personal expenses has improved.

loans.use: to buy comforters, pillows, fans, and various types of clothing.

loans.name: Hanou

texts.fr:
Hanou est une femme âgé(e) de 48 ans. Elle est mariée å un  maçon. Elle a 02 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 24ans et le dernier 20ans.
Hanou travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et maîs depuis 1995. Elle vend à domicile et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté est le manque de fonds pour renforcer son activité. 
Hanou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut utiliser son profit pour s’alimenter et assurer la santé de la famille par l’achat des médicaments. 
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Hanou is a 48-year-old woman.  She is married to a mason and has two children who both attend school.  Her oldest child is 24 years old, the youngest is 20.

Hanou has been reselling charcoal and maize since 1995.  She buys her goods in Lomé and sells from home.  She is now facing a lack of funds to strengthen her activity.

Hanous has requested her first loan from WAGES for the purchase of sacks of charcoal.  She wants to use her profits to buy food and to ensure her family's health through the purchase of medications.

She says that with the profits, she is planning to support her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, solicita un nuevo préstamo, esta iniciando su labor agrícola, para la que necesita invertir en la compra de 1000 plantas de chile, abono y foliares, con esto iniciara su siembra de chiles, esperando no tener ningún inconveniente y poder sacar una buena cosecha.
El efecto que tuvo con su préstamo anterior fue buena, aumentaron su producción en granos básicos, mejorando también sus circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
David has requested a new loan. He is starting his agricultural work, and needs to invest in the purchase of 1,000 chile plants, manure and fertilizer. He will use these items to plant chile peppers, and hopes that he will have no problems and will be able to have a good harvest.

His previous loan had a positive impact, increasing his produce of basic foodstuffs and improving his family circumstances.

loans.use: To buy 1,000 chile pepper plants, manure and plant fertilizers.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón es un hombre de 35 años de edad, de estado civil casado, con 3 hijos a su cargo, vive con su esposa e hijos, en el Caserío Nueva Esperanza, del Distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de Piura. Solo cuenta con el servicio básico de luz eléctrica, el consumo de agua lo hacen a través de una pileta comunal.

La actividad principal que desarrolla Ramón es la crianza/venta de ovinos y aves de corral, donde les da alimento concentrados y cuando alcanzan el tamaño y peso exacto lo comercializa a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace más de 12 años; además cuenta con 1.0 ha de terreno agrícola sembrados de limón, los cuales fueron heredados por su padre, donde le permite tener otros ingresos adicionales. Su esposa también  lo apoya en toda  actividad que realiza
 
El monto del crédito otorgado será de S/. 1000 nuevos soles, y  será para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo y la compra de  alimentos balanceados para el engorde de animales y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio y así seguir creciendo en su negocio, lo cual le permite mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramón is 35 years of age and married, with three children under his care. He lives with his wife and children in the village of Nueva Esperanza, located in the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura. He only has basic electricity services, and water is obtained from a communal water fountain.


Ramón’s main activity is the raising and sale of sheep and free-range poultry. He raises these animals on concentrated feed and, when they have reached the right size and weight, he sells them to wholesalers in the area. He has been carrying out this activity for more than 12 years. He also has one hectare of farmland planted with lemons. He inherited this land from his father, and it gives him additional income. Ramón’s wife also supports him in all his business activity.


Ramón has requested a total of 1,000 nuevos soles. He plans to use this money to buy fertilizers for his crops and balanced feed to fatten his animals. This will allow him to sell the animals at a better price, and therefore continue to expand his business, improving his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops and balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de crédito que le brindaron y por las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que la motivan a emprender cada día más. Su meta es construir su propio horno artesanal para la elaboración de pan.El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de pan como azúcar, levadura, harinas, manteca.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the Alondras communal bank. She is 31 years of age and a mother of two children, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years.

Marcelina makes and sells bread. She is thankful to the institution for the loan facilities offered, as well as the training she receives from her communal bank, as this motivates to be more enterprising every day. Her goal is to build her own traditional oven to bake bread. She plans to invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to bake bread, namely sugar, yeast, flour and lard.

loans.use: To buy sugar, yeast, flour and lard to make bread.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir mas en el negocio, comprara elotes para hacer tamales, aceite, leña y gas, que son los necesarios para la elaboración de este producto.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior,ya que invirtio en su tamaleria y pollos, aumentando sus ganancias y proporcionándole los recursos para seguir trabajando, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado, viviendo mas solvente con su familia.
texts.en:
María has requested a new loan to invest more in her business. She plans to buy corncobs to make tamales, as well as oil, firewood and gas, which are required to make this product.

Her prior loan had a positive impact, as she invested it in her tamal business and bought chickens. This increased her income and gave her the resources needed to keep working. Her financial situation has also improved, and she now lives with her family in a more solvent manner.

loans.use: To buy corncobs, firewood, oil and gas.

loans.name: Señor De Coylluritti De Ccorao Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO; este banco está situado en la ciudad de Cusco.

La socia Irene tiene 41 años, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante ella trabaja en su negocio todos los días siendo de esta manera que  la socia saca adelante a su familia,  la socia cocina diversos platos de comida como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante y continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevas mesas y sillas para su restaurante.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, venta de productos como cebada, picantería, compra y venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes y venta de artesanía.

La socia que se adjunta a la foto pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank "Señor de Coylluritti de Ccorao", which is located in the city of Cusco.

Irene is a member who is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business. Irene works every day in her business so that she can help her family move forward. She prepares various dishes such as chicken and rice, stir-fried beef, soups, and other items. Irene is a cheerful and responsible person who has tremendous drive to succeed and wants to continue working for her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy new tables and chairs for her restaurant.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling food, selling barley, preparing spicy foods, buying and selling vegetables, managing a grocery store, and selling handicrafts. The member who appears in the corner photo requested permission to be absent for work reasons.

The members are grateful for this method of accessing credit and promise to complete their loan payments.

loans.use: to buy new tables and chairs.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es:
Napoleón, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque tiene la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, comprara al por mayor maíz, para revender, esto le ayudara para tener trabajo y una fuente de ingreso de la cual pagara las cuotas de este préstamo y le ayudara a su familia.
El considera que con el préstamo anterior pudo obtener buenos ingresos y fortaleció el negocio, sus condiciones han mejorado, teniendo mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Napoleón has requested a new loan as he needs to invest in his business. He plans to buy wholesale corn to resell. This will help him to have a job and a source of income, which he hopes to use to repay this loan and help his family.


He thinks that his former loan helped him to obtain good income and strengthen his business. His conditions have improved, as he now has higher income.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale corn.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucía es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace  5 años. Se dedica a la compra de ganados vacunos y porcinos. Se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros. Le gusta mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que gracias a ellas aprendió a invertir de manera adecuada su dinero y a valorarse a sí misma. Su meta es comprar un terreno para la construcción de una vivienda. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ganados vacuno y porcino.
texts.en: Lucía is a member of the Alondras communal bank. She is 32 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 5 years. She buys and sells cattle and pigs. She is proud of what she has been done with her savings. She really likes the trainings she gets in her communal bank since thanks to them she learned to invest her money adequately and value herself. Her goal is to buy some land to build her house. The new loan will be invested in buying cattle and pigs.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Aboudou

texts.fr: Aboudou est un homme de 34ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et a 02 enfants âgés de 07ans et 04ans. Ils vont tous à l’école. Il est vulcanisateur et vendeur de pneus et a démarré en 2003. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et est  aidée par 02 personnes. Sa difficulté est le manque de fonds pour s’approvisionner. Il sollicite ce second prêt de WAGES pour acheter plus de pneus afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Il veut agrandir l’activité et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Aboudou is a 34 year old man. He is married to a trader and has 02 children who are 07 and 04 years old. They both attend school. Since 2003 he has been a vulcanizer and trader of tyres. He gets his supplies from Lomé and is assisted by 02 people. He has difficulty finding the funds to buy his supplies. He is requesting this second loan from the microfinance institution WAGES to buy more tyres so that he can better meet the needs of his customers. He wants to expand his business and see his family thrive.

loans.use: To buy tyres

loans.name: Wanyinan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANYINAN est formé de trois  personnes qui sont des parentés. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Alaba Josephine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Alaba Josephine est mariée et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Alaba Josephine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Alaba Josephine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a huit ans, Alaba Josephine mène comme activité la vente de plastiques, des mèches et des glacières dans son quartier. Alaba Josephine achète ses produits au Nigeria. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Alaba Josephine désire augmenter son stock de produits. Pour ce faire, Alaba Josephine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANYINAN, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The WANYINAN group is made up of three people who are related. The group representative, named Alaba Josephine, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the fourth time the group is seeking ALIDé's financial assistance in order to grow their business. Alaba Josephine is married and the mother of three children, all in school. Alaba Josephine lives with her husband and children and covers, together with her husband, the various household expenses. Alaba Josephine did not go to school. For eight years, Alaba Josephine has been a seller of plastic goods, hair extensions and coolers in her neighbourhood. Alaba Josephine buys the products in Nigeria. 
With the goal of better meeting her customers' needs and increasing her income, Alaba Josephine wishes to increase her stock of products. In order to achieve this, Alaba Josephine is seeking, together with the other members of the WANYINAN group, a fourth loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods, hair extensions and coolers.

loans.name: Modénu

texts.fr: Agée de 47ans, Modénu est mariée à un chauffeur et a un enfant de 20ans. En 2000, elle vend des sacs de charbons de bois et de l’huile à toutes personnes à domicile. Elle vend seule et elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite ce troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter du charbon pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, avoir plus de bénéfice et avoir une vie confortable.
texts.en: Modénu is a 47 year old woman who is married to a driver and has a 20 year old child. Since 2000, she has been selling bags of charcoal and oil to all kinds of customers from her home. She works alone and buys her supplies in Lomé. She is requesting a third loan from the microfinance institution WAGES to buy charcoal so that she can better meet the needs of her family. She wants to reinvest in her business, increase her profits and have a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and oil

loans.name: Safaya

texts.fr: Agée de 40ans et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 à l’école, Safaya est revendeuse de maïs, ignames et charbon de bois il y a 16ans à la maison. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et est à son second crédit de WAGES. Ce montant lui servira à acheter des charbons de bois, du mais et des ignames. Elle veut augmenter son stock, devenir une distributrice de charbons de bois et avoir une maison dans l’avenir. Son conjoint est commerçant.
texts.en: Safaya is 40 years old and mother to 04 children, 03 of whom attend school. Safaya has been selling corn, yams and charcoal from her home for 16 years. She gets her supplies from Lomé and is requesting her second loan from the microfinance institution WAGES. This amount will enable her to buy charcoal, corn and yams. She wants to increase her stock, become a distributor of charcoal and in the future have a house. Her spouse is a trader.

loans.use: To buy yams, bags of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr: Agé de 29ans et marié à une revendeuse Mohamed pour subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de son  enfant âgé de 03ans, il vend des pneus d’occasion à toutes personnes  et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Il est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus  de marchandises. Il veut épargner ses profits, élargir l’activité et assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille. Son activité a été démarré en 1996.
texts.en: Mohamed is 29 years old and is married to a trader. In order to satisfy the needs of his wife and his 03 year old child, he sells used tyres to all types of customers and gets his supplies from Lomé. He is requesting his second loan from the microfinance institution WAGES in order to buy more goods. He wants to save his profits, expand his business and guarantee the basic needs of his family. He started his business in 1996.

loans.use: To buy tyres

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi est une jeune dame de 27ans. Elle a 02 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 07ans et le dernier 04ans. Son conjoint est informaticien. Elle est  revendeuse de produits congelés et des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2008. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des marchandises. Elle veut agrandir son activité et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Akuvi is a young 27 year old woman. She has 02 children including 01 that attends school. The eldest is 07 years old and the youngest is 04 years old. Her partner is an IT technician. She has been selling frozen food and grocery products since 2008. She is requesting her second loan from the microfinance institution WAGES in order to buy goods. She wants to expand her business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy frozen food products and essential grocery products

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Agé de 35ans et marié à une commerçante, Yaovi est revendeur de cartes de recharge depuis 2001. Il exerce l’activité dans une baraque et vend à toutes personnes. Sa difficulté principale est le manque de fonds pour acheter beaucoup de marchandises. Il sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des cartes de recharges. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité et bien prendre en charge la famille.
texts.en: Yaovi, who is 35 years old and married to a trader, has been selling recharge cards since 2001. He carries out this business in a booth and sells to all sorts of people. His main difficulty is that he lacks the funds to buy a large quantity of goods. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy recharge cards. He wants to reinvest in his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy recharge cards

loans.name: Jose Carlos Emguelber

texts.es:
José, necesita un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer en negocio, comprándose plantas ornamentales, rosa, veranera, orquídeas, corazón chino, entre otras especies que son del agrado de los clientes, con esto lograra comprar una buena cantidad para variara el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior logro crecer con mas plantas, de este buen negocio ha logrado ampliar su vivienda y poder incrementar el negocio.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan so that he can strengthen his business. He will buy ornamental plants, roses, bougainvilleas, orchids, Chinese bleeding heart plants, and other species that are enjoyed by his customers. By purchasing a large quantity of plants, he will be able to diversify his business.

With his previous loan, José was able to grow more plants. As a result of doing well, he was able to expand his home and increase his business.

loans.use: to buy ornamental plants, roses, bougainvilleas, orchids, Chinese bleeding heart plants, and other species of plants.

loans.name: Essohanim

texts.fr:
Essohanim est une femme âgé(e) de 34 ans. Elle est mariée à un employé dans une société de la place.
Essohanim travaille comme revendeuse de charbon de bois et du maîs  depuis 2007. Elle exerce l’activité à la maison et sa difficulté principale est la mévente. 
Essohanim a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des charbons de bois.  Elle veut agrandir son commerce et ajouter d’autres activités complémentaires. Elle veut assurer la sécurité de sa famille en matière de santé et les voir s’épanouir.
texts.en: Essohanim is a 43-year old woman who is married to an employee of a local company. She has been working as a retailer of charcoal and corn since 2007 and carries out this business from home. Her main difficulty is the slump. Essohanim has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy charcoal. She wants to expand her business and add complementary activities. She wants to ensure her family's security in terms of health and see them flourish.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Wangninangbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINANGBE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Jacqueline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Jacqueline est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un certain Ulrick. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses diverses charges, Jacqueline vend des plastiques dans un marché du Benin. Jacqueline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Jacqueline sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINANGBE.
texts.en:
The WANGNINANGBE group is made up of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, named Jacqueline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the third time the group is seeking ALIDé's financial assistance in order to grow their business. Jacqueline is 24 years old and is married to a man named Ulrick. They have two children, both of whom attend school and live at home. Jacqueline lives with her husband and children and covers the various household expenses, together with her husband. 
In order to meet these expenses, Jacqueline sells plastic goods in a market in Benin. She buys her stock in a market in Benin. In order to better satisfy her customers' needs, and to increase her income, Jacqueline is seeking a third loan with ALIDé, together with the other members of the WANGNINANGBE group.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: Maricruz  es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 20 años de edad, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Se siente orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado con sus ahorros, en las reuniones de su Bancomunal conoció muchas amigas que comparten sus diferentes experiencias. Le gusta mucho las  capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que gracias a ellas aprendió a invertir de manera adecuada su dinero. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos para su negocio.
texts.en: Maricruz is a member of the Alondras communal bank. She is 20 years old, and she has been a member of FINCA Peru for 2 years. She works selling beauty products by catalog. She feels proud of all she has achieved with her savings. At the meetings of her communal bank she has met many friends who share their diverse experiences. She really likes the training she receives in her communal bank, because thanks to these sessions she learned to invest her money effectively. The new loan she is requesting will be invested in buying cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Violy

texts.es: Violy  de 45 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 6 años. . Ella tienen un negocio que inició hace 4 años, por iniciativa de una amiga, porque Violy requería apoyar el bienestar a de su hogar; así fue como empezó poco a poco y  gradualmente logró vincularse a dos organizaciones, que venden productos suministrando una guía especializada; sus principales líneas de artículos son cosméticos y la bisutería en general; como Violy  es una mujer emprendedora, conoce muy bien las oportunidades de negocio que se le presentan y las aprovecha, por eso también vende bebidas y refrescos en general a sus vecinos y transeúntes que la visitan.  Su meta mas adelante es comprar su vivienda y ampliar la cobertura de clientes, pero su gran desafío, para esta última meta es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograrlo; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domestico, con el cual comprará productos de aseo personal y de tocador, cosméticos, colonias y otras mercancías , pues se acerca el día de las madres, época en la cual los negocios se oxigenan si tiene suficientes inventarios para lograr impactar a sus clientes y eso es lo que ella piensa hacer con su credikiva Incrementar sus ventas, inyectando ese capital de trabajo adicional.
texts.en:
Violy, 45, lives with her spouse and two children aged 4 and 6. She has a business she started four years ago at a friend's urging because Violy needed to support her household's wellbeing. So she gradually started up and was able to get connected with two organizations that sell products providing a specialized guide. Her main product lines are cosmetics and costume jewelry in general. Since Violy is an enterprising woman she knows business opportunities well when they present themselves, and takes advantage of them. Therefore she also sells drinks and refreshments in general to her neighbors and passerbys who visit her. 

Her goal down the road is to buy her home and expand her client base. Her great challenge for this latter goal is having sufficient working capital to achieve it. Thus she turns to her Kiva loan, her first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domestico. With it she will purchase toiletries and personal grooming products, cosmetics, colognes and other merchandise, given that Mothers' Day is coming up, a time in which businesses get a breath of fresh air if they have enough inventory to be able to impact their clients. So that's what she plans on doing with her Kiva loan: increase her sales and inject that additional working capital.

loans.use: to purchase toiletries and personal grooming products, cosmetics, colognes and other merchandise.

loans.name: El Chadai Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EL CHADAI est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Philomène, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Philomène est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Codjo. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Philomène vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges du ménage sont assurées par le couple. Philomène n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Philomène vend depuis une dizaine d'année, du charbon de bois et du savon liquide de façon secondaire, à son domicile. Philomène s’approvisionne au Benin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Philomène désire obtenir un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EL CHADAI.
texts.en: The EL CHADAI group comprises three friends. the group representative, named Philomène, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time that the group is seeking ALIDé's financial assistance - with a view to growing their business. Philomène is 36 years old and is married to a man named Codjo. They have four children, all living at home and attending school. Philomène lives with her husband and children. The various household expenses are covered by the couple. Philomène did not attend school. In order to cover the various expenses, for about ten years Philomène has been selling charcoal, and also liquid soap on a secondary level, from her home. Philomène buys her supplies in Benin. In order to increase her stock of supplies, and to better meet her customers' needs, Philomène is seeking a loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the EL CHADAI group.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and liquid soap accessories.

loans.name: Karlenis Yasmin

texts.es:
Karlenis, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere invertir en la compra de ropa con nuevo estilos para salir a vender, comprara blusa, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior, esto le ayudara a seguir trabajando.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue muy favorable, teniendo la mercadería necesaria para salir a vender, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Karlenis is requesting another loan because she wants to invest in buying new styles of clothing to go out and sell.  She will buy blouses, skirts, pants, and underwear.  This will help her to continue working.

The effect she had from the previous loan was very favorable.  Having the merchandise necessary to go out and sell, her economic situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, and underwear.

loans.name: Reyna Yamileth

texts.es:
Reyna, se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niñas de dos y cinco años de edad, este negocio de Reyna surgió por iniciativa propia, como medio para proveer lo necesario a su familia, tiene un año en el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de blusas, short, ropa interior, para poder fortalecer el negocio y tendrá mejor variedad para ofrecer a su familia y poder generar más ganancias.
La aspiración de Reyna es mantener su negocio, crecer en él ya que así le provee a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Reyna works selling clothing as a mobile vendor. She is 25 years old. She is a single mother with two daughters, aged two and five. This business of Reyna's arose on her own initiative, as a means of providing her family with the necessities. She has operated the business for one year. 

She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, shorts and underwear, so that she can strengthen the business and have a greater variety to offer, and so that she can generate more earnings for her family. 

Reyna's aspiration is to maintain her business and expand it, since this will allow her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shorts and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cashew nuts, coconut, sapodilla, cherry, chamomile, sweet potato, squash and peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle. a 24-year-old single woman, resides in Carangan, Ozamis City, Misamis, Occdental where she helps support her family's needs from the small amount (PHP 5,000) she earns from her garden business. She has gardened for three years to supplement the income of her father, who is a farmer.

Michelle joined GDMPC this year and is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap and beverages.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Salvadora, necesita un nuevo préstamo para el fortalecimiento del negocio, comprara verduras frescas plátanos, papas, tomates, cebollas y pescado fresco para salir a vender de manera ambulante, esto le ayudara a generar mas ingresos y mantenerse en el comercio.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo una experiencia buena, ya que logro comprarse pollos para salir a vender, logro pagar el préstamo y actualmente continua trabajando por crecer y tener lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Salvadora needs another loan to strengthen her business.  She will buy fresh vegetables, bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fresh fish to go out and sell on foot.  This will help her generate more income and support herself in her business.

With the previous loan she had a good experience because she managed to buy herself chickens to sell.  She was able to pay back the loan, and currently she continues working so she can to grow and have the necessities for her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fresh fish.

loans.name: Haydee Paulina

texts.es: Haydee es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de artesanía como bordados  de chompas y mantas. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años. Ella aprendió a ser puntual y responsable gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal, está contenta porque sus ahorros han incrementado y siente que ha progresado al lado de su familia y en su negocio. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilos procesados que utiliza en la elaboración de bordados para su negocio.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of Alondras Communal Bank.  She is 42 years old and has two children.  She sells crafts such as embroidered sweaters and blankets.

She has been a member of FINCA Perú for five years.  She learned to be punctual and responsible thanks to the trainings she receives in the communal bank.  She is happy because her savings have increased and she feels she has progressed with her family and in her business.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying processed thread that she uses to do embroidery for her business.

loans.use: to buy processed thread for embroidery.

loans.name: Casia

texts.es: Casia es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 44 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la confección de enaguas y mandiles en los mercados. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 6 años.
